column2: As part of our growth strategy, we are seeking a talented AWS Solutions Architect to join our team and play a key role in architecting, designing, and implementing cloud solutions for our clients. Responsibilities: Design, develop, and implement scalable and reliable cloud solutions on the Amazon Web Services (AWS) platform to meet the unique requirements of our clients. Collaborate with clients, stakeholders, and cross-functional teams to understand business objectives, gather requirements, and translate them into robust AWS architectures and designs. Utilize Infrastructure as Code (IaC) principles and tools such as AWS CloudFormation or Terraform to automate the provisioning and management of cloud infrastructure. Lead cloud migration initiatives, assess existing on-premises infrastructure, identify opportunities for optimization, and execute migration plans to AWS cloud services. Implement security best practices and compliance standards in AWS environments, including IAM policies, network security, encryption, and compliance frameworks such as GDPR, HIPAA, or SOC 2. Monitor the performance of AWS resources, identify bottlenecks, and implement optimization strategies to improve performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency. Provide technical leadership, guidance, and mentorship to junior team members, empowering them to grow their skills and excel in their roles. Keep abreast of the latest AWS services, features, and best practices, and evaluate their applicability to our client projects to ensure optimal solution design and delivery. Qualifications: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field. Proven experience as a Solutions Architect or Cloud Architect, with a focus on designing and implementing solutions on the AWS platform. column2: Atlassian JIRA Architect    you will be responsible for the overall architecture, design, and implementation of our JIRA platform. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, including business users, developers, and administrators, to understand requirements and design solutions that meet organizational need  Job Description: As an Atlassian JIRA Architect, you will be responsible for the overall architecture, design, and implementation of our JIRA platform. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders, including business users, developers, and administrators, to understand requirements and design solutions that meet organizational needs. Key Responsibilities: Lead the architecture and design of the JIRA platform to ensure scalability, performance, and reliability. Design and implement custom workflows, fields, screens, and dashboards in JIRA to support business processes. Develop integrations between JIRA and other systems, tools, and platforms to streamline workflows and enhance productivity. Provide guidance and best practices to JIRA administrators and developers on configuration, customization, and extension of the platform. Define and enforce governance policies, security controls, and access management in JIRA. Evaluate and recommend plugins, add-ons, and third-party tools to enhance the functionality and capabilities of JIRA. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, prioritize initiatives, and deliver solutions aligned with business objectives. Stay updated with the latest trends, technologies, and best practices in JIRA architecture and administration. Mentor and coach team members on JIRA architecture, best practices, and emerging technologies. Requirements: Proven experience as a JIRA Architect or similar role, with a strong background in architecting and implementing JIRA solutions. Deep understanding of JIRA architecture, data model, APIs, and integration capabilities. Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages such as Groovy, Python, or JavaScript. Experience with agile methodologies and agile tools such as JIRA Agile or JIRA Align. Excellent communication and collaboration skills with the ability to interact effectively with stakeholders at all levels. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Certifications such as Atlassian Certified JIRA Administrator (ACP-JA) or Atlassian Certified JIRA Project Administrator (ACP-JPA) are a plus.
column11: Atlassian Jira, Jira Tool, Atlassian

column2: As an AEM Solution Architect, you will oversee all aspects of the AEM practice, including client strategy, delivery, team and client management to ensure the success of projects     As an AEM subject matter expert, you will be responsible for translating enterprise content management requirements of clients into technical designs which includes enterprise-level architecture and implementing strategies using components of the Adobe AEM, DAM, and other Adobe Experience Cloud Products     You will also work closely with the business development team to identify new opportunities and expand existing client relationships                       What You ll Be Doing                Responsible for the creation and integration of solutions using AEM. Translate enterprise content management requirements into comprehensive technical architectural designs, leveraging Adobe AEM, DAM, and Experience Cloud Products using industry best practices         Lead and Involved in planning and budgeting of AEM projects including Frontend, Middleware, Backend, Environment setup, Deployment cluster, etc         Participate in client meetings, lead solution discovery, finalize scope, manage documentation and ensure successful delivery of AEM based projects. Work closely with the business team to convert new opportunities.         Work on complex projects includes multi-site and multi-channel delivery, personalization/ targeting, content aggregation syndication, multi-lingual support, automated workflow management, omni-channel marketing, commerce integrations, etc         Apply understanding and integrate with Adobe Experience Cloud products such as the Campaign, DAM, Commerce, Analytics, Target and Audience Manager         Develop and oversee OSGi bundles, AEM templates, HTL/Sightly components and services, AEM launches, workflows, localization features, AEM Mobile and Forms applications and the AEM DAM         Ensure implementation of coding best practices to optimize page load, performance, security and scalability of the entire application         Conduct load testing and performance tuning activities to ensure AEM solutions meet performance requirements under varying loads                           What We d Love To See              Minimum 5 years of AEM experience with 4-5 enterprise implementation experience     Total 10-12 years have experience and AEM Certification is an added advantage     Significant exposure to working with ClientLibs, Java Content Repository (API), Sling Web Framework and Apache Felix OSGi framework     Develop and oversee OSGi bundles, AEM templates, HTL/Sightly components and services, AEM launches, workflows, localisation features, AEM Mobile and Forms applications and the AEM DAM     Expertise in Hands-on implementation of Java technologies (J2SE 1.7/1.8), Java EE, Servlets, JSP, JSTL and Tag libraries     Strong hands-on experience of Components, Templates, Taxonomy, metadata management, Forward and Reverse Replication, workflow, Content Publishing and unpublishing, Tagging, Deployment and Content migration/ planning     Significant hands-on experience with AEM and very strong concepts of OSGi, Apache Sling, Apache Sightly, Apache Oak and Adobe Dispatcher     Experience with one or more other Adobe marketing cloud products like Dynamic Tag Manager, Target, Analytics, AEM Forms, Adobe Communities, Campaign Manager or Livefyre     Should have technical proficiency in architecture, configuration, DevOps, integrations and customization, performance optimisation, sizing for enterprise applications, CDN, Disaster Recovery, and caching     Has implemented Quality Processes for projects like Continuous Integration (Bamboo/Jenkins), SonarQube, Code reviews (Manual and Automated), code Formatters, Automation testing, etc     Mastery of all relevant core Java technologies that are used in most Java-centric CMS/WCM platforms, including but not limited to XML, XSL, XSLT, XSD, server-side programming models, and other related presentation, middle-er persistence frameworks                         It d Be Great If You Had              Fantastic executive presence, capable of gaining trust of C level executives     Strong verbal, presentation and written communication skills     Excellent problem-solving skills, with a demonstrated ability to identify issues, solve them quickly and well, and know when to rely on internal resources to assist     Exceptional team building and team management skills, with proven experience managing virtual teams     Educational Qualification Required: B. Tech/B.E. - Computer Science / Information Technology, M.C.A.                         What You Can Expect              Opportunity to work with a diverse and well-experienced team.     To be part of the team who creates phenomenal growth stories for worlds renowned brands.     Professional Growth Roadmap.     Real-time mentorship and guidance from the leaders.     A workplace that invests in your career, cares for you and is fun engaging.     You can be yourself and do amazing work.
column11: Performance tuning, Core Java, XML, JSP, CMS, XSLT, Apache, Open source, Middleware

column2: Job Description: Overview:  Spiro is leading the way in transforming electric mobility in Africa, focusing on cutting-edge electric mobility and energy storage solutions. Operating in countries such as Benin, Togo, and Rwanda, Spiro is committed to sustainable development, technological innovation, and community impact. We are seeking a highly skilled Zoho CRM Solution Architect to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and implementing effective solutions using Zoho CRM platform to meet the business requirements of our clients. As a Zoho CRM Solution Architect, you will collaborate with clients, business stakeholders, and development teams to analyze needs, design solutions, and oversee implementation projects. The role requires strong technical expertise in Zoho CRM, excellent communication skills, and the ability to translate business requirements into scalable CRM solutions. Location: Pune, India Responsibilities: Collaborate closely with business units to translate needs into actionable Zoho solutions. Design and architect Zoho CRM solutions that align with client goals and requirements. Serve as the Zoho technical SME,empowering teams to get the most out of the platform. Develop comprehensive project plans,  including timelines, milestones, and resource allocation. Lead and manage CRM implementation projects, ensuring successful delivery within scope, budget, and timeline constraints. Configure and customize Zoho CRM modules,  workflows, and automations to meet specific business needs. Conduct workshops, training sessions, and   knowledge transfer sessions for clients and internal teams. Drive efficiency by developing reusable   Zoho architecture assets. Provide guidance and support to  development teams in implementing Zoho CRM solutions. Collaborate with cross-functional teams,      including developers, analysts, and business stakeholders, to drive      successful CRM initiatives. Stay updated with the latest Zoho CRM      features, functionalities, and best practices. Perform system integration tasks to      connect Zoho CRM with other business applications as needed. Qualifications: Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Masters degree preferred. Proven experience as a Zoho CRM Solution Architect or similar role, with at least 7+ years of hands-on experience      in Zoho CRM implementation and customization. Proven ability to communicate technical concepts to business users. Skilled in Zoho Deluge scripting language Strong understanding of Zoho CRM functionalities, modules, and capabilities. Proficiency in Zoho CRM customization  tools, such as workflows, scripts, APIs, and integrations. Experience in leading CRM implementation projects from conception to completion. Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions. Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with clients and internal teams. Project management experience, with proficiency in project planning, resource management, and risk assessment. Zoho CRM certifications, such as Zoho Certified Developer or Zoho Certified Consultant, are a plus. Experience with other CRM platforms, such as Salesforce or Microsoft Dynamics, is beneficial.
column11: Zoho Crm, Zoho, CRM

column2: As a Cloud Cost Optimization Specialist, your primary responsibility is to analyse and optimize the cloud infrastructure and resources used by the organization to achieve cost efficiency without compromising performance and reliability. You will work closely with the cloud architecture team, finance department, and other stakeholders to identify cost-saving opportunities, implement cost optimization strategies, and monitor and control cloud expenses.            Key Responsibilities:           1. Cost Analysis and Optimization:          Conduct detailed analysis of cloud infrastructure and services to identify potential cost optimization opportunities.    Review current cloud usage patterns, pricing models, and billing reports to understand cost drivers and identify areas of improvement.    Collaborate with cross-functional teams to analyse resource utilization, right-sizing opportunities, and workload optimization strategies.    Recommend and implement cost optimization initiatives while ensuring performance, scalability, and security requirements are met.        2. Cost Monitoring and Reporting:          Develop and maintain cost monitoring and reporting mechanisms to track cloud expenses and identify cost overruns or deviations from budget.    Generate regular reports and present cost optimization findings to management and stakeholders.    Implement cost allocation methodologies and provide visibility into cloud costs for different departments, projects, or business units.        3. Cloud Resource Management:          Identify and implement strategies to optimize the utilization of cloud resources, such as instances, storage, databases, and networking components.    Work closely with the cloud architecture team to design and implement effective resource allocation and provisioning strategies.    Leverage cloud-native tools, automation, and scripts to manage and control cloud resources effectively.    Identify opportunities for utilizing reserved instances, spot instances, and other cost-saving mechanisms provided by cloud service providers.        4. Cost Optimization Best Practices:          Stay up to date with the latest trends, best practices, and industry benchmarks in cloud cost optimization.    Research and evaluate new cost management tools and technologies to improve cost visibility, forecasting, and control.    Develop and maintain documentation, guidelines, and training materials related to cloud cost optimization.        5. Collaboration and Stakeholder Management:          Collaborate with finance teams, project managers, and business stakeholders to align cloud cost optimization efforts with organizational goals and priorities.    Provide cost optimization recommendations and guidance to project teams during the cloud architecture and design phases.    Foster strong relationships with cloud service providers and stay informed about their cost models, pricing updates, and cost-saving programs.          Qualifications and Skills:           Bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.    Strong understanding of cloud computing concepts and experience working with major cloud platforms (Amazon Web Services).    Proficient in cloud cost management and optimization tools and techniques.    Solid knowledge of cloud resource provisioning, monitoring, and performance optimization.    Familiarity with budgeting, forecasting, and financial analysis related to cloud services.    Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.    Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex cost optimization concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.    Ability to work collaboratively in cross-functional teams and manage multiple projects simultaneously.    Cloud certifications (Solution Architecture)
column11: Cloud, Cost optimization

column2: Role Description Delivery of Scitara DLX services, Ancillary Lab Informatics   Services, Customer Support, and Validation   Key Responsibilities Provide Implementation, configuration and validation services to   customers using DLX. Responsible for post implementation customer support.  Work with Scitara partners to provide implementation and allied   customer services for DLX and any other Lab Informatics systems as applicable. Collaborates closely with cross-functional teams, including   product management, solutions architects, and software engineers, to design   and develop scalable and efficient solutions. Leverages his/her deep technical expertise and experience to   contribute to the design and development of robust and scalable solutions.  Plays a key role in aligning technical strategies and solutions   with Scitara's overall business objectives.  Collaborate with product management, engineering, and leadership   to provide valuable insights, identify technical opportunities, and   contribute to the development of long-term technical roadmaps. As a technical leader, provides guidance and mentorship to junior   team members, fostering a culture of technical excellence and continuous   learning. Contributes to technical documentation and delivers technical   presentations when required. Participates in customer calls with ownership of   discovering needs, influencing solutions.   Ideal Candidate   Educational Qualifications Masters degree in appropriate field of study   Experience Should have a minimum of 13+   years IT experience in Life Sciences and Pharmaceutical Domain. Should have hands on   experience in implementing and validating Lab Informatics for more than 5   years. column2: Designing and deploying Azure-based solutions: The Azure Architect should have experience in designing and deploying Azure-based solutions that meet the business and technical requirements of an organization. This includes designing cloud infrastructure, configuring and deploying cloud services, and managing Azure resources.      Advising on Azure best practices: The Azure Architect should be well-versed in Azure best practices and should be able to advise clients on how to best leverage the platform to achieve their business goals. This includes identifying the appropriate Azure services, designing for scalability and availability, and ensuring that solutions are secure and compliant.      Developing technical documentation: The Azure Architect should be able to develop technical documentation that outlines the architecture, design, and implementation of Azure solutions. This includes creating diagrams, documenting configurations, and creating deployment guides.      Managing Azure resources: The Azure Architect should have experience in managing Azure resources, including virtual machines, storage accounts, and Azure Active Directory. This includes configuring resource groups, setting up monitoring and alerting, and managing access control.      Collaborating with stakeholders: The Azure Architect should be able to collaborate effectively with stakeholders, including business leaders, developers, and operations teams. This includes conducting technical workshops, providing technical guidance, and ensuring that solutions align with business requirements.      To be qualified for an Azure Architect role, a candidate should typically have a bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field, along with several years of experience in designing and implementing Azure-based solutions. Azure Architect certification such as the Azure Solutions Architect Expert is also highly recommended.

column2: We are looking for a Cloud Architect to deliver customer projects implementing Infrastructure solutions in the space of Oracle Infrastructure Cloud space. As Cloud Architect you will       be responsible for managing cloud environments and leveraging cloud technology to solve business problems.     work closely with stakeholders to understand customer business needs and lead cloud migration projects and teams of cloud engineers.       The following are the key roles:         Security Management:    Ensuring that the cloud infrastructure is secure and meets industry standards.       Cloud Management Strategies:    Devising and rolling out strategies to manage cloud environments effectively.       Cost Optimization:    Optimizing the cost of ownership across the enterprise.       Governance and Compliance Monitoring:    Establishing a governance and compliance monitoring framework to ensure that the cloud infrastructure is compliant with industry standards.       Cloud Automation/Orchestration:    Automating and orchestrating cloud infrastructure to improve efficiency and reduce manual intervention.       Cloud Monitoring:    Monitoring cloud infrastructure to ensure that it is performing optimally.       Key Responsibilities:       Managing business development opportunities for new projects and participating in pre-sales/sales activities, including shaping delivery approaches, and providing effort estimates.     Partnering with customers, engineering, and product teams to design, demonstrate, and deploy Oracle Cloud architectures.     Serves as a leading contributor for customers on technical cloud solutions, identifying gaps and influencing engineering roadmaps for customer-driven features.     Defining technology roadmaps and solutions, offering detailed functional expertise in the analysis and design of business processes enabled by Oracle, and leading Cloud Migration projects.     Displaying product/ application understanding through customized presentations, supporting customers from Proof of Concept (POC) to production deployment     Creating/ distributing technical assets such as Solution strategy, solution maps, blog posts, and video demonstrations.     Participation in the initial stages of large-scale global projects, focusing on the Discovery phase and conducting requirements analysis, develop architectures, and translate business needs into solutions.     As a leading contributor, provide direction and mentoring to others.       Experience:       11 to 15 years experience in supporting and managing data centres, cloud/ network infrastructure, and customer-focused mission critical environments is essential.     5+ years experience of engineering, architecting, or supporting Oracle IaaS/PaaS solutions.     Have a comprehensive understanding of Cloud Infrastructure, Databases, and Applications, along with the ability to design Cloud Infrastructure and delve into specific details.     Experience in migration of Infrastructure & Applications to the Cloud.     Working with service delivery, cross functional and business teams in complex environment     Technical / Analytical abilities in all areas of IT infrastructure including architecture, systems engineering, network infrastructure, databases, storages, backups/ disaster recovery, server deployment, operating systems, web technologies, monitoring, & security. column2: ?                 1. Education: A bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, telecommunications, or a related field is often required. Previous work as a telephony engineer, architect, or administrator is beneficial.                                  3. Microsoft Teams Expertise: In-depth knowledge of Microsoft Teams telephony features and capabilities, including Direct Routing, Calling Plans, and integration with SIP trunks or PBX systems.                                  4. Telephony Systems: Proficiency in traditional telephony systems, such as PBX, PSTN, SIP, and VoIP, is crucial for seamless integration with Microsoft Teams. Experience in setting up the Teams Enterprise Voice/Meeting policies. (Normalization rules, Dial plan, PSTN usage, routes, translation rules) Ability to configure and manage PSTN Voice gateway, AudioCodes, SBC, SBA, PBX. Ability to explain Microsoft Teams signaling flows and various troubleshooting methods. Expertise in debugging / troubleshooting the Teams call quality issues, using SIP / HTTPs log analysis. Familiar with Wireshark, Netmon, Snooper, Putty, Teams monitoring reporting tools. Experience with Power shell Cmdlets and scripts to maintain Microsoft Teams. Networking Skills: Strong understanding of networking principles, protocols, and topologies, as well as QoS (Quality of Service) for call optimization. Good understanding of VOIP SIP, ICE - Turn Stun, RTP/RTCP/Media flow Codecs, SRTP, HTTPS/HTTP, DNS, DHCP protocols.                              6. Scripting and Automation: Familiarity with scripting languages like PowerShell for automation tasks related to Microsoft Teams telephony management.                                      7. Security: Knowledge of telephony security best practice.

column2: During the sales cycle, you will lead the proof of concepts, demonstrating ability to meet and exceed customer requirements, often in the customer's production environment.          Following successful sales operations, you will be ensuring high levels of customer satisfaction, driving adoption, and expanding the use of HeadSpin products.          You will work closely with our sales and services team to identify upsell opportunities and renewal risks and be engaged with cross-functional teams to successfully manage and resolve issues affecting your customers.          You will have the opportunity to work directly with our Product Management, Engineering, and Marketing teams to share your knowledge and experiences to ultimately improve our business and our customers success.          Work with customers to ensure onboarding, user adoption, retention, and overall success.          Impart technical leadership and direction on all aspects of products and services.          Track accounts to identify churn risk and work proactively to eliminate that risk.          Ensure any account issues are resolved quickly, utilizing resources from across Technical Support, Sales, Engineering etc.          Function as the voice of the customer and provide internal feedback on how it can better serve our customers.          Maintain and gain knowledge of the languages and technologies supported.                      What You Need              2-5 years experience (or more) working with at least one of the following languages: Java, and Python.          Experience in Tosca & Tricentis.          Experience and competence working at OS command lines including Unix, Linux and Windows command prompt and Unix/Linux/Windows shell scripting.          Experience with iOS or Android.          Experience with open source testing and Automation frameworks Appium/Selenium and methodology and principles of test automation          Good understanding of Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment(CD) tools          Knowledge of basic networking components and concepts.          Ability to troubleshoot basic networking issues that may prevent communication between hosts.          Experience with web servers and common relational databases used in today's application architectures.          Ability to understand SQL and write SQL queries.          Excellent communication and presentation skills.          Passionate about technical sales and working with customers.          Ambitious and self-motivated with a high emotional IQ.          Ability to work on multiple POCs and post-deployment customer account management concurrently.          Highly coachable with a strong desire to improve and grow as a professional.          Strong ability to align technical concepts and features to business needs.          Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or similar fields desired.          Able and willing to travel as the job requires.          2-4 years of software development          Ability to use APIs

column2: As the Cloud Pre-Sales/ Senior Cloud Architect, you will provide technical leadership in support of Galaxy IT s initiatives in cloud computing and automation, with a focus on the design of systems and services that run on cloud platforms.           The Senior Cloud Architect reports into the IT organization as a member of the Platform Services team but will contribute to various product group initiatives to provide architectural leadership and best practices.     Additionally, the Senior Cloud Architect will be responsible for ensuring that critical applications are designed and optimized for high availability and disaster recovery.     The Platform Services team designs, provisions, and maintains Galaxy s global presence for on premise and cloud compute and storage resources across all regions.     The ideal candidate will have a bachelor s degree in Computer Science or closely related subject; an advanced degree is preferred.     In addition, 10 or more years experience in designing large and complex IT operations in large organizations.     The position requires strong leadership and team building skills and must be able to collaborate effectively with a group of high performing individuals.         Duties and Responsibilities:         Demonstrate knowledge of cloud architecture and implementation features (OS, multi-tenancy, virtualization, orchestration, scalability, Disaster Recovery plan)     Demonstrate knowledge of DevOps tool chains and processes.     Act as a Subject Matter Expert to the organization for cloud end-to-end architecture, including AWS, GCP, OCI, Azure, Private Cloud and possible future providers, networking, provisioning, and management.     Demonstrate leadership ability to back decisions with research and the why, and articulate several options, the pros and cons for each, and a recommendation.     Maintain overall industry knowledge on latest trends, technology, etc.     Develop solutions architecture and evaluate architectural alternatives for private, public and hybrid cloud models, including IaaS, PaaS, and other cloud services.     Contribute to DevOps development activities and complex development tasks.     Accelerate the shift of Galaxy s remaining on-premises core service to the cloud.     Define optimal design patterns and solutions for high availability and disaster recovery for applications.     Build out IaC-first deployments and assist other team members and groups to do the same.     Drive scope definition, requirements analysis, functional and technical design, application build, product configuration, unit testing, and production deployment     Ensure delivered solutions meet/perform to technical and functional/non-functional requirements.     Provide technical expertise and ownership in the diagnosis and resolution of an issue, including the determination and provision of workaround solution or escalation to service owners.     Ensure delivered solutions are realized in time frame committed; work in conjunction with project sponsors to size and manage scope and risk.     Provide support and technical governance, expertise related to cloud architectures, deployment, and operations.     Provide thought leadership in industry and to fellow team members across business and technical project dimensions solving complex business requirements.     Demonstrate forward thinking around where the organization is going and how technology can support these efforts.     Advocate and define cloud architecture vision from a strategic perspective, including internal and external platforms, tools, and systems.         Key Qualifications:       For consideration, you must bring the following    minimum    skills and behaviours to our team:       10+ years of experience spanning at least two IT disciplines, including technical architecture, network management, cloud computing, systems engineering, infrastructure, security, networking, data & analytics, application development, middleware, database management or operations.     Experience with AWS, GCP, OCI, Azure, Private Cloud and VMWare enterprise implementations.     Exposure to multiple, diverse technologies and processing environments.     Knowledge of all components of technical architecture, full stack expertise.     Knowledge of business process re-engineering principles.     Strong understanding of network architecture and application development methodologies     Strong understanding of service-oriented architecture and client/server systems     Strong skills in IaC solutions such as Terraform (preferred), AWS CDK, CloudFormation, and/or Azure Resource Manager.     Ability to understand IT systems and business process interactions through design thinking.     Exposure to other CSPs, such as AWS, Azure, OCI, and Google.     Willingness and desire to mentor other team members in cloud best practices.     Ability to collaborate with diverse sets of stakeholders to find secure, scalable, cost-effective, and mutually beneficial solutions for the company.         Education:         Bachelor s degree in computer science, systems analysis or a related study, or equivalent experience

Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for helping customers solve their challenges and achieve their goals.

column2: We are looking for an experienced Infrastructure Monitoring Tools Solution Architect with 8-12 years of proven expertise in designing and implementing monitoring solutions with a focus on Zabbix, Nagios, OpsRamp, SolarWinds, Prometheus, and similar tools       As a Solution Architect, you will play a key role in architecting end-to-end monitoring solutions that meet the complex requirements of our organization and ensure the stability, performance, and availability of our infrastructure and applications                                     **Responsibilities:*                                      ?                     1. Lead the end-to-end design and architecture of infrastructure monitoring solutions, leveraging Zabbix, Nagios, OpsRamp, SolarWinds, Prometheus, and other relevant tools.                             2. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business objectives, technical requirements, and existing infrastructure environments.                             3. Assess current monitoring capabilities and infrastructure landscape to identify gaps, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement.                             4. Develop comprehensive monitoring strategies and roadmaps aligned with business goals, industry best practices, and emerging trends.                             5. Design and implement scalable, reliable, and cost-effective monitoring architectures that address the dynamic needs of our organization.                             6. Define monitoring standards, policies, and procedures to ensure consistency, compliance, and effectiveness across the organization.                             7. Evaluate and recommend appropriate monitoring tools, technologies, and integrations to meet specific use cases and requirements.                             8. Work closely with engineering and operations teams to implement monitoring solutions, configure monitoring tools, and integrate with existing systems.                             9. Provide technical leadership and guidance to cross-functional teams on monitoring best practices, tool selection, implementation methodologies, and troubleshooting techniques.                             10. Conduct performance analysis, capacity planning, and trend analysis using monitoring data to proactively identify and address potential issues.                             11. Stay updated on the latest advancements, features, and best practices in infrastructure monitoring tools and technologies and evaluate their applicability to our environment.                             12. Collaborate with vendors, partners, and industry experts to assess new technologies, products, and services in the monitoring space.                                     ?                       **Requirements:*                                      ?                     1. Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field. Masters degree preferred.                             2. 8-12 years of hands-on experience in designing, architecting, and implementing infrastructure monitoring solutions.                             3. Expertise in Zabbix, Nagios, OpsRamp, SolarWinds, Prometheus, or similar monitoring tools, with a deep understanding of their capabilities, limitations, and configurations.                             4. Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure components and technologies, including servers, networks, storage, virtualization, cloud services, and microservices architectures.                             5. Proficiency in scripting and automation using languages such as Python, Bash, PowerShell, or similar.                             6. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills with the ability to translate complex requirements into scalable and efficient monitoring solutions.                             7. Effective communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.                             8. Proven experience leading cross-functional teams and driving projects to successful completion.                             9. Relevant certifications such as Zabbix Certified Professional, Nagios Certified Administrator, SolarWinds Certified Professional, or Prometheus Certified Administrator are desirable

column2: Sitero is currently seeking a highly skilled and experienced Cloud Architect to join our dynamic team.          As a Cloud Architect, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the smooth operation, performance, and security of our organizations systems.          You will be responsible for managing a wide range of technologies, including Linux and Windows systems, cloud platforms such as Azure and AWS, virtualization with VMWare, SharePoint, and more.              The ideal candidate will possess exceptional technical expertise, a strong aptitude for problem-solving, and a proactive mindset to maintain a 100% uptime environment.          This position will involve working on high-value projects, providing guidance to junior team members, driving automation initiatives, and refining our infrastructure, IT Compliance, and network security, while creating a streamlined partnership with our Clinical, Quality, and Data Management teams.                         ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES                 Manage and maintain all Linux and Windows-based systems, ensuring their availability, stability, and optimal performance.             Develop and maintain scripts in Python or PowerShell to automate routine administrative tasks, streamline operations, and enhance efficiency.             Oversee the deployment, configuration, and administration of Azure and AWS environments, including provisioning and managing virtual machines, storage, and networking components.             Support and maintain SharePoint environments, including user management, permissions, and site configuration.             Monitor and analyze system performance, identifying and resolving issues to ensure high availability and optimal resource utilization.             Implement and maintain robust security measures, including access controls, data encryption, and vulnerability management, to safeguard systems and data.             Collaborate with cross-functional teams to plan, implement, and support technology initiatives and projects, ensuring adherence to best practices and organizational policies.             Provide guidance and mentorship to junior cloud engineers, assisting with troubleshooting complex issues and sharing knowledge and expertise.             Continuously evaluate and recommend improvements to existing systems, processes, and procedures, driving innovation and efficiency.                 EDUCATION AND EXPERIENCE REQUIRED                 BE/BTech in Computer Science or equivalent             Proven experience working as a Senior cloud engineer or Architect, with a focus on Linux and Windows servers in Azure and AWS.             Minimum 10 years of relevant experience             Expertise in scripting languages such as Python or PowerShell, with the ability to automate tasks and develop custom tools.             Strong working knowledge of cloud platforms, specifically Azure and AWS, including experience with infrastructure-as-code (IaC) tools like Terraform or CloudFormation.                 In-depth understanding of VMWare virtualization technologies, including deployment, configuration, and troubleshooting of virtual machines.             Proficiency in administering SharePoint environments, including user management, permissions, and site configuration.             Sound knowledge of network fundamentals, including TCP/IP, DNS, DHCP, VLANs, and routing protocols.             Familiarity with security best practices and technologies, including access controls, encryption, vulnerability management, and identity and access management (IAM).             Excellent problem-solving skills, with the ability to analyze complex issues and provide innovative solutions.                 Strong interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams and provide guidance and mentorship.             Experience managing leading life sciences system implementations would be an advantage (ie CTMS, Drug Safety, EDC, Quality, CRM, Data Analytics, HRMS, Accounting / Finance, etc),                          COMPENSATION BENEFITS                 Sitero proudly offers an impressive compensation package and benefits, including a competitive salary, Variable pay, paid time off, and healthcare and retirement benefits.              COMMITMENTS                 Standard Hours 40 hours per week, one hour lunch, Monday - Friday. Additional hours as needed.              Willing to work in shifts as and when needed.

column2: *POSITION   SUMMARY   The Cybersecurity   Architect is a dedicated and meticulous cybersecurity specialist working   within the Infrastructure and Operations (I&O) department. In this   role you will operate both independently and as part of a team to ensure our   software, hardware, cloud resources, infrastructure, and related components   are protected from cyber attacks. This includes developing security systems,   analyzing current systems for vulnerabilities, and handling any and all   threats to our resources in an efficient and effective manner. Candidates   should have strong IT skills and a deep understanding of cyber security   methodologies.   *DUTIES   Work to understand security and technology   requirements related to the infrastructure technology products and business applications   to subsequently translate those into a clear, consistent cybersecurity   technology roadmap, build consensus in the infrastructure & operations   organizations, influence leadership support to execute successfully and   implement successfully. Lead, mentor, and grow junior and mid-level   team members in: compute, data storage, data center, operating systems,   database, networking, security tools/cyber, virtualization, automation, cloud   and engineering applications for on premise and off premise deployments Drive the development of security solutions   with reusable components that can be leveraged in different ways to meet   globally diverse business requirements from a broad stakeholder community   with input and requirements from multiple security personnel Evolve security posture in current   Infrastructure & Operations offerings (I&O) into next generation   capabilities aligned to new and emerging business needs and security   requirements such as on premise and off-site cloud capability, automation,   and IT security requirements. Responsible for the implementation of the Security   full tech stack at I&O platforms Balance cost, quality, performance, capability   and productivity variables effectively. Design, develop and analyze Cybertechnology roadmaps   as well as an implementation plan based on current vs. future state in a   cohesive manner and in collaboration with your colleagues, peers and adjacent   service owners. Develop, review, analyze and maintain current   security architectures and system design documentation for related products   and services at I&O Design, build, administer, manage   cybersecurity controls for the I&O (i.e., IDS/IPS, EDR, DLP, WAF, UBA) Act as the subject matter expert for one or   more of the following areas: Network security, endpoint security, database   security, server security and identity management. Develop strategic roadmaps and tactical   remediation plans to address cyber security vulnerabilities and architectural   weakness in I&O Ensure cyber security tooling and underlying   infrastructure aligns to regulatory and security requirements Create Metrics and reporting capabilities to   continuously monitor identifies risk areas in I&O Champion the adoption of new cyber security   technologies and drive the implementations into the I&O platforms.

            Experience with Infrastructure as Code and infrastructure testing strategies;             Experience with systems reliability, load balancing, monitoring, logging;             Experience with CI/CD pipelines end-to-end, from code commits to production; column2: Qualcomm is actively seeking a Senior Staff Enterprise Technology Architect with exceptional expertise in cloud solutions architecture and full-stack cloud implementation     This pivotal role is responsible for driving the architectural vision and implementation of comprehensive cloud solutions that support Qualcomms strategic business objectives     The ideal candidate will have a robust understanding of cloud infrastructure, platforms, and software development, with the ability to design, deploy, and optimize end-to-end cloud solutions that are scalable, secure, and highly performant         Principal Duties and Responsibilities:         Lead the strategy, design, and implementation of Qualcomm s cloud architecture, focusing on end-to-end solutions that encompass infrastructure, platform services, and application layers.     Architect scalable, secure, and resilient cloud solutions across various cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud), ensuring optimal integration with existing systems and alignment with business goals.     Develop and execute a full-stack cloud implementation strategy, including infrastructure as code (IaC), CI/CD pipelines, microservices, and serverless architectures, to facilitate agile development and operational efficiency.     Collaborate with IT and business stakeholders to translate business requirements into technical solutions, ensuring cloud architectures meet current and anticipate future needs.     Promote best practices in cloud security, compliance, and governance, ensuring all cloud solutions adhere to industry standards and regulatory requirements.     Lead the evaluation, selection, and implementation of cloud technologies and tools, driving innovation and continuous improvement in Qualcomm s cloud capabilities.     Provide expert guidance on full-stack development methodologies, advocating for a holistic approach to cloud implementation that encompasses both front-end and back-end development practices.     Mentor and develop team members in cloud technologies and full-stack implementation techniques, fostering a culture of technical excellence and innovation.             Minimum Qualifications:         Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.     At least 10 years of experience in technology architecture, with a significant focus on cloud computing and full-stack development.     Expert knowledge of cloud infrastructure, platform services, and application development, with demonstrated experience deploying enterprise-level solutions on major cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud).     Experience with infrastructure as code (IaC), automation, and orchestration tools (eg, Terraform, Ansible, Kubernetes).     Strong understanding of cloud security principles, compliance frameworks, and industry best practices.     Excellent problem-solving, strategic thinking, and leadership skills, with the ability to drive complex projects to successful completion.           Preferred Qualifications:         masters degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or related discipline.     Professional certifications in cloud architecture (eg, AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional, Google Cloud Professional Architect) and full-stack development methodologies.     Proficient in a range of programming languages and frameworks relevant to full-stack development (eg, JavaScript, Python, Java, React, Angular, Node.js).     ArchiMate 3 Practitioner Certification.     Experience in leading full-stack cloud transformation projects within large, global organizations.     Deep understanding of DevOps practices and tools, with a track record of implementing efficient CI/CD pipelines.     Advanced knowledge of database technologies, both SQL and NoSQL, and data modeling for cloud-native applications.           Education Requirements:         A Bachelor of Science in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field is required.     A masters degree in the aforementioned fields is strongly preferred

column2: We are fast-growing, flexible and agile. We adapt to new opportunities and are more open to new ideas making it exciting to work for us.     You ll get the opportunity to work on a more varied selection of projects, expanding your skillset and giving you a much broader range of experience.     Youll be a part of a growing team; you will work in small, multi-disciplinary, fast-moving teams that co-builds products, services, and experiences. You will play a critical role in innovating and building solutions from scratch, iterating quickly and getting them client/market-ready.     Executives and company owners, are much more accessible, you can learn from them, express your ideas, build relationships, and get noticed. You ll find there is more camaraderie with everyone feeling a greater sense of ownership of what the business does, pleasant environment to work in, but it also gets you closer to the success of the business as you play an integral part, something which is very rewarding.     The performance appraisal process is much more flexible and is more directly linked to your performance and career progression. This often means higher percentage increases for high performers.     We follow hybrid work, enables you to work closer to where you live or closer to where you want to live.

column2: As an Enterprise Solution Architect, your primary responsibility is to design and oversee the implementation of technology solutions that align with the strategic goals and objectives of an organization     You will work closely with business stakeholders, technology teams, and vendors to define the architecture and ensure the successful delivery of scalable and efficient solutions     Here are the key responsibilities and tasks associated with this role:Solution Design and Architecture:Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their requirements, objectives, and challenges     Define and develop enterprise-level solution architecture that meets business needs, aligns with industry best practices, and leverages existing technology assets     Create architectural blueprints, diagrams, and documentation to communicate the design and facilitate implementation     Technology Evaluation and Selection:Evaluate and recommend appropriate technology platforms, frameworks, and tools to support the solution architecture     Conduct research and stay up to date with emerging technologies, trends, and industry standards relevant to the organization's technology landscape     Assess vendor products and services, considering their compatibility with the enterprise architecture and ability to meet business requirements     Stakeholder Engagement and Collaboration:Engage with business stakeholders, technology teams, and vendors to gather requirements, understand constraints, and ensure alignment between business goals and technical solutions     Collaborate with project managers, business analysts, and development teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications and actionable plans     Facilitate discussions, workshops, and presentations to articulate the benefits, risks, and implications of proposed solution architectures     Solution Delivery Oversight:Provide technical leadership and guidance throughout the development and implementation phases of projects     Review and approve technical designs, ensuring adherence to architectural principles, standards, and best practices     Monitor and assess the progress of solution implementation, identifying and resolving any technical issues or risks that may arise     Performance and Scalability Optimization:Analyze and optimize solution performance, scalability, and reliability by identifying and addressing potential bottlenecks or constraints     Define and recommend infrastructure requirements, including hardware, software, and network configurations, to support the solution's performance and scalability objectives     Conduct performance testing and tuning activities to ensure the solution meets performance expectations     Security and Compliance Considerations:Ensure that solution architectures comply with security standards, regulations, and industry best practices     Collaborate with cybersecurity teams to identify and address potential security vulnerabilities and risks     Define and implement security controls and mechanisms to protect sensitive data and ensure data privacy     Continuous Improvement and Innovation:Stay abreast of industry trends, advancements, and emerging technologies relevant to enterprise solution architecture     Continuously assess and enhance existing solution architectures and technology landscapes to drive innovation, efficiency, and agility     Provide recommendations for process improvements, automation, and optimization of technology solutions     Mentoring and Knowledge Sharing:Mentor and guide junior architects, developers, and technical staff, fostering a culture of learning and professional development     Share knowledge, best practices, and architectural patterns with the broader technology community within the organization     As an Enterprise Solution Architect, you play a critical role in ensuring that technology solutions align with business objectives and deliver value to the organization     Your expertise in solution design, architecture, and technology enables you to design scalable and robust solutions that drive business growth, innovation, and operational efficiency     Your strong communication and collaboration skills, combined with your ability to navigate complex stakeholder landscapes, facilitate the successful implementation of enterprise-wide technology initiatives
column11: Solution architecture, Stakeholder Engagement, Automation, Architecture, Enterprise architecture, Performance testing, data privacy, Technology solutions, Continuous improvement, Operations

column2: We are seeking a talented and experienced DevOps Architect to join our team      The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining customer DevOps infrastructure, ensuring scalability, reliability, and efficiency      This role requires strong expertise in tools such as Terraform, Ansible, Helm, and Docker, as well as a deep understanding of cloud platforms and CI/CD pipelines      The DevOps Architect will collaborate closely with internal Product Engineering, Professional Services Engineering, and security teams to streamline processes and optimize our software delivery lifecycle      The Architect will work with Client IT Teams / Architects to analyse their environments, assess customer DevOps tools and frameworks, define potential Architectures, and recommend Best Practices      Your mission as a DevOps Architect is to help our customers design highly scalable architectures and build resilient infrastructure using distributed systems.      With commercial experience and a strong understanding of infrastructure as code, you will have the opportunity to expand our containerisation story using Docker and Kubernetes.          Responsibilities        Understand customer requirements and provide guidance on DevOps deployment strategies. Build new scripts based on customer requirements whilst leverage R3 s deployment templates. Help our customers with scalability, disaster recovery and maintainability of their solutions.      Design, implement, and maintain scalable and resilient DevOps infrastructure. Develop automation scripts and workflows using Terraform, Ansible, Helm, Docker, and other relevant technologies.      Build and manage CI/CD pipelines to automate software delivery, testing, and deployment processes.      Build, Test and Implement continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines using industry-standard tools such as Jenkins, Docker, GitHub Actions, or Cloud Provider Tools and Frameworks from Azure / AWS / GCP      Implement monitoring, logging, and alerting solutions to ensure system health and performance. Troubleshoot AND Resolve issues across the entire stack, from infrastructure to application code, Incl. build failures, deployment errors, and infrastructure problems in a timely manner.      Deliver deployment strategy workshops with R3 customers to understand their bespoke infrastructure / application hosting requirements, platforms and tools.      Ensure security best practices are implemented throughout the DevOps processes, including code scanning, vulnerability management, and access control.      Collaborate with cross-functional teams to drive innovation and continuous improvement in our DevOps practices. Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in DevOps and recommend new tools and methodologies to enhance our processes.      Ensure all assigned work items are fully managed, taking accountability for delivery, scope, ensuring successful implementation. Guide DevOps Solution Engineers on day to day Technical Guidance and help build a cohesive DevOps Team.                Key Skills Required:        Proven experience as a DevOps Architect, with a minimum of 8 years of experience Architecting and Designing enterprise grade scaled solutions. Strong Experience with Terraform, Ansible and Helm charts automation with a focus on designing and implementing scalable infrastructure is a must.      Strong Experience with containerization technologies such as Docker and container orchestration tools like Kubernetes. Proficiency in managing deployments using Helm charts      Cloud experience in Azure DevOps, AWS or Google Cloud. Experience with microservices architecture and serverless computing deployment with AKS / EKS / GKE is highly desirable      Proven experience with monitoring systems like DataDog, Prometheus.      Familiarity with DevOps practices in regulated industries such as healthcare or finance.      Expert knowledge of version control systems (e.g., Git) and source code management workflows.      Excellent troubleshooting skills and the ability to analyze complex systems.      Strong communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively in a cross-functional team environment.      Relevant certifications (e.g., AWS/Azure Certified DevOps Engineer, Certified Kubernetes Administrator) are a plus.                Desired Skills:        Kubernetes experience in a commercial enterprise product and thorough understanding of taking software to production.      Understanding of DLT / Blockchain technologies and benefits.      Willingness to learn new skill and be able to solve complex problems.

column2: We believe that great customer service is a company value, not a job role that you can hire for. Every single person in the company is responsible for creating delight in the lives of our users. Doing whats right for the customer is baked into the Atlan DNA.     As Atlan grows at a rapid pace, we continue to encounter diverse technology stacks, and our customers need our help in integrating Atlan into this stack. Therefore we are scaling our Customer Solutions Architecture group to better integrate Atlan into the customer Landscape.     Atlan is built upon an Open API framework and the Customer Solution Architecture Team is at the forefront of driving Innovation for our customers using this framework.     As part of the Customer Solution Architecture team, be part of a highly motivated and driven Customer Experience group working with amazing data teams at customers such as Plaid, Monster and WeWork.     If youre looking for a high-impact opportunity at a fast-growing startup and truly believe that user and customer delight can be one of the biggest moats for a company, this is the role for you.         Your mission at Atlan         At Atlan, the customer Journey is broken into three parts - Onboarding, Adoption and Innovation. The Customer Solution Architects (CSA) are integral in helping our customers through all three phases of their journey.     The CSA team works closely with the Customer Success Manager as well as Customer teams of Data Architects, Data Engineers and Data Platform owners to onboard customers onto Atlan, drive Atlan adoption and use the power of Active Metadata to automate and innovate.     During the Onboarding phase, the CSA team focuses on Integrating Atlan into the customer tech stack. Integrations include Snowflake, Redshift, Databricks, Bigquery, DBT, Tableau, Looker and many more.     During the Adoption phase, the CSA team focuses on driving adoption for use cases such as Data Discovery, Data Governance, Metric Management, Embedded collaboration and more.     During the Innovation phase, the CSA team drives significant customer value by using Active Metadata to power automation and Innovation in the form of use cases such as Auto PII detection, Active metadata management, dynamic data pipeline management and more.     The CSA team is also the bridge between the Customer Experience Group and Product and Engineering, working closely to ensure customer feedback is communicated to Product, and guiding the future growth of Atlan.     As part of the the CSA team, you will build expertise in tools in the Modern Data Stack and be the trusted advisor to help and guide Customer stakeholders     As part of the CSA team, you will partner closely with Sales, Product, Engineering and Marketing to build thought leadership and expertise in the Active Metadata category         What makes you a great match for us         You have multiple years of experience in customer-facing technical roles (Consulting, Field Engineer, Solutions Engineer, Sales Engineer, Solution Architect).     You have hands-on, management or consulting experience in Data Engineering and Analytics.     You are familiar with the tools, terminology, architecture, processes and best practices for Data Warehouses and Data Lakes, ELT/ETL, Business Intelligence, orchestration, and data quality tools.     Highly value prior experience with tools across the data estate including Snowflake, dbt, Fivetran, Airflow, Monte Carlo, and any major BI tool (eg Looker, Tableau, Power BI, Sigma and Thoughtspot).     Experienced using APIs and in one or multiple coding languages with a strong preference for Python.     Knowledge of Cloud architecture fundamentals in AWS, Azure or GCP - Highly available fault tolerant systems, IAM policies, security groups, networking (vpc peering and privatelink).     Bonus if you have exposure to serverless computing, distributed systems, and streaming platforms (eg Kafka, Kinesis, Pub/Sub).     Desire to deepen your knowledge in current technologies and learn new ones.     Expertise in managing customer challenges to resolution.
column11: Solution architecture, Automation, Product engineering, metadata, Networking, Coding, Consulting, Customer service, Business intelligence, Analytics

column2: Enterprise Architect? Enterprise Architect is the key solution orchestrator in bringing together the right combination of Enterprise IT, Cloud & Digital Technologies to build end-to-end solution to address specific client business problems. While deep technical solution expertise is needed, this also needs the right combination of Business and commercial acumen to help drive the right Transformation programs for clients.?   Key job responsibilities: Understanding the business strategy & vision and translating them into enterprise-wide technology strategy in alignment with client strategic priorities? Assess the impact of the business strategy on the architecture landscape, including organization, information and infrastructure and applications Work with the client and EY stakeholders to understand client business requirements, priorities, and strategic direction to build Technology Transformation strategies and roadmap.? Key focus for Technology Transformation could include Enterprise IT Transformation, Cloud and Data Transformations. Architect the end-to-end solution by choosing the right technologies and platforms Develop architecture standards, principles and guidelines for the enterprise; govern enterprise-wide portfolio of systems / platforms, quality of software getting delivered and function as guardian of the strategy and architecture to make sure that new initiatives comply with the set guidelines Work with the Competencies and Practices to arrive at suitable project approach, estimate the project duration, staffing, and costs.? Work with the Delivery Governance team to analyze project delivery risks and mitigations.? Be a trusted advisor on 'innovation' with ability to frame key business and technology trends within the context of the client's objectives. Ability to identify the potential implications and impacts of the associated trends.   Skills and Experiences: 20+ years of experience in Technology Consulting and System Integration projects 5-10 years experience in Cloud Transformation projects  involving Cloud Application Architecture, Cloud Native Application principles (AWS, Azure) Minimum of 4-5 years of experience in Enterprise Architecture roles? Experience in Application Architecture & Design for Microservices in Cloud platforms (Spring boot, Serverless, Docker, Kubernetes), SQL/NoSQL databases) Design and implementation of APIs, event streaming using KAFKA and batch based integrations Implementation experiences with architecture and design patterns (e.g., Cloud, Microservices, Integration, Presentation). Architecture and implementation experience for large scale highly available and scalable solutions or platforms based on microservices and cloud-native architecture Expertise in at least one Cloud Hyperscaler (AWS or Azure preferred) with hands-on experience in PaaS components and certification (AWS or Azure) Experience in DevSecOps processes, automation and toolchain Good experience on security and infrastructure architecture considering cloud platforms like AWS, Azure TOGAF certification will be a plus Experience in any of these sectors will be a plus - Travel & Hospitality Digital Solution Architect? Digital Solution Architect is the key solution orchestrator in bringing together the right combination of Digital Technologies and Solutions end-to-end to address specific client business problems.?   Key job responsibilities: Setting and driving platform/solution vision & strategy in alignment with business strategy, customer focus and enterprise architecture guidelines Architect the end-to-end solution by choosing the right technologies and platforms Systems integration of enterprise-wide platforms and/or managing across technology life cycle from solution design, build and deployment and run of complex solutions Developing full stack solutions and multi-platform design and architecture; ability to work across multiple architecture domains - application, data, DevOps, infrastructure, cloud, network, and security Develop architecture standards, principles and guidelines for the enterprise; govern enterprise-wide portfolio of systems / platforms, quality of software getting delivered and function as guardian of the strategy and architecture to make sure that new initiatives comply with the set guidelines Define technical solutions and a unified framework for delivery consistency throughout all program workstreams. Suggest training, and staff development activities as needed. ?Identify requirements for system and application performance monitoring for an enterprise scale environment Work with the Competencies and Practices to arrive at suitable project approach, estimate the project duration, staffing, and costs.? Partner with architects and DevSecOps engineers throughout the program, provide solution governance to ensure the application life-cycle is entirety implemented in accordance with industry best practices? Work with the Delivery Governance team to analyze project delivery risks and mitigations.?   Skills and Experiences: 15+ years of experience in Technology Consulting and System Integration projects 5-10 years experience in Cloud Transformation projects ??involving Cloud Application Architecture, Cloud Native Application principles (AWS, Azure) Minimum of 4-5 years of experience in Solution Architecture roles? Experience in Application Architecture & Design for Microservices in Cloud platforms (Spring boot, Serverless, Docker, Kubernetes), SQL/NoSQL databases) Design and implementation of APIs, event streaming using KAFKA and batch based integrations Implementation experiences with architecture and design patterns (e.g., Cloud, Microservices, Integration, Presentation). Architecture and implementation experience for large scale highly available and scalable solutions or platforms based on microservices and cloud-native architecture Expertise in at least one Cloud Hyperscaler (AWS or Azure preferred) with hands-on experience in PaaS components and certification (AWS or Azure) Experience in DevSecOps processes, automation and toolchain Good experience on security and infrastructure architecture considering cloud platforms like AWS, Azure TOGAF certification will be a plus Experience in any of these sectors will be a plus - Travel & Hospitality

column2: Solution Design: Design and architect Azure-based solutions, ensuring they align with business goals, security requirements, and industry best practices.      Security and Compliance: Ensure the Azure solutions adhere to security standards, compliance regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA), and implement security measures to protect data and resources.      Cost Optimization: Optimize Azure resources to minimize costs while maintaining performance and scalability, leveraging tools like Azure Cost Management.      High Availability and Disaster Recovery: Design solutions with high availability and disaster recovery capabilities to ensure business continuity.      Networking: Configure Azure networking components, such as virtual networks, subnets, and VPNs, to support the application s connectivity requirements.      Identity and Access Management (IAM): Implement identity and access controls using Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and Azure role-based access control (RBAC).      Monitoring and Performance Tuning: Set up monitoring and alerting solutions to proactively identify and address performance issues. Continuously optimize resource usage.      Documentation: Maintain comprehensive documentation of architecture, configurations, and processes for Azure solutions.      Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, operations, and business stakeholders, to ensure successful project delivery.      Stay Current: Stay up-to-date with Azure s latest features, services, and best practices to make informed recommendations for solution improvements.      Pre Sales : Supporting the Pre-Sales process, scoping out technical requirements and solutions to meet the strict security and performance requirements of prospective clients.      Provide recommendations to clients with respect to cloud migrations and prepare technical implementation roadmaps for Azure adoption.      Continuous Learn : learn, and learn by staying up-to-date on all technical developments related to Azure and other public cloud platforms.      Participate with contract discussions that involve technical decisions.          Must Skills :           Microsoft Azure Expertise:    Must have Profound knowledge of Microsoft Azure services, including but not limited to Virtual Machines, Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS), Azure Functions, Azure SQL Database, Azure DevOps, Azure Logic Apps, Azure Active Directory, and more.        Database Expertise:    Must have Proficiency in database technologies, both relational (e.g., SQL Server) and NoSQL (e.g., Cosmos DB), can be helpful for designing data-intensive solutions.        Azure Functions Development:    Must have Experience in serverless computing and Azure Functions for building event-driven, scalable applications.        Big Data and Analytics:    Must have Knowledge of Azure Data Services like Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Databricks, and Azure Synapse Analytics for handling big data and analytics workloads.        Security and Compliance:    Must have Strong understanding of cloud security best practices, identity and access management (IAM), encryption, and compliance frameworks. Knowledge of Azure Security Center and Azure Policy is essential.        Networking:    Must have Expertise in designing and configuring Azure networking components such as Virtual Networks, Subnets, VPNs, Azure ExpressRoute, Azure Firewall, and Azure Load Balancers.        Identity and Access Management (IAM):    Must have Deep knowledge of Azure Active Directory (Azure AD) and Azure role-based access control (RBAC) for managing identities and permissions.        Monitoring and Management:    Must have Proficiency in setting up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor, Azure Application Insights, and Azure Log Analytics. Ability to manage resources using Azure Management Groups and Azure Policy.        Scripting and Automation:    Must have Strong scripting skills using tools like PowerShell, Python, or Azure CLI for automation and orchestration tasks.        High Availability and Disaster Recovery (HA/DR):    Must have Experience in designing highly available solutions with failover and disaster recovery capabilities using Azure features like Azure Site Recovery, Azure Backup, and Availability Sets.        Containerization and Orchestration:    Must have Familiarity with containerization technologies (Docker) and container orchestration platforms (Kubernetes) on Azure (e.g., AKS).        DevOps Practices:    Must have understanding of DevOps principles, CI/CD pipelines, and Azure DevOps for automating software delivery and infrastructure provisioning.        Cost Management:    Must have Ability to optimize Azure resources for cost efficiency using tools like Azure Cost Management and Azure Budgets.          Good to have skills          Multi-Cloud Experience: Familiarity with other cloud platforms like AWS or Google Cloud can be beneficial, especially if your organization operates in a multi-cloud environment.      Hybrid Cloud Knowledge: Understanding hybrid cloud solutions that bridge on-premises infrastructure with Azure can be valuable for organizations with hybrid deployments.          Qualifications and Education Requirements         Bachelor s degree in computer science, information technology, or a related field.      Proven experience as an Azure Architect or similar role.
