column2: The AWS Solution Architect is responsible for Migrations. These responsibilities include working directly with our customers to guide them through the details of Cloud transformation and migration of critical business workloads, accelerating the customers cloud migration journey.               Duties and Responsibilities             Work alongside our account executives and solution architects to help customers accelerate their cloud migration journey and modernize their business applications on AWS         Work with our strategic customers, you will help the customer assess their readiness for Cloud adoption and advise and guide the customer in developing a strategic plan to transform IT processes and organization to support their Cloud adoption         Focus on understanding customer business drivers as well as the compelling event/s driving their cloud adoption at the onset of a large migration engagement         Work with the AWS team and customer to help develop a comprehensive migration plan, lowering risk and cost while accelerating adoption         Gain hands-on technical credibility with internal as well as customer technical leaders         Create documentation on migration best practices.         This job description is not designed to be a comprehensive list of the duties and responsibilities required of the employee in this position, as duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice           Qualifications             Education             Bachelor s Degree in computer science from an accredited college or university, preferred           In lieu of a Bachelor s degree, 3 years of experience in the same or closely related field/occupation, may be counted towards 1 year of education               Experience             Customarily has at least 7 years of experience in a Solutions Architect, Enterprise Architect, or Lead Architect role leading the discovery, design, and construction of large-scale Enterprise Migration solutions         Customarily has at least 7 years of experience in systems engineering, implementation, or consulting experience in lieu of a Bachelor s degree or equivalent military experience         Customarily has at least 2 years of experience planning and executing large scale IT and business transformations to the cloud         Customarily has at least 2 years of experience architecting, designing, migrating workloads to the public cloud         Demonstrated experience in a range of migration discovery, profiling, migration automation, and operations technologies and tools             Skills/Attributes             Synoptek core DNA behaviors:           Clarity     :       Possesses excellent communication skills, makes a concentrated effort to speak the customers language. Ability to field questions with concise, well-constructed responses           OwnIT:       Shows integrity, innovation, and accountability in completing daily assignments           Results     :       Solutions focused and driven to resolve conflict quickly and precisely. Proactively looks for opportunities to contribute to the company s business goals           Growth     :       Willing to learn and ask questions. Constantly looking for new ways to improve yourself. Ability to adapt and grow in a fast-paced environment           Team:       Embraces both customers and colleagues as team members. Ability to be flexible, respectful, engaged and collaborative             Ability to creating, articulate, and position an innovative and compelling value proposition so that customer executives clearly realize the benefits and transformation value of migrating to AWS         Ability to define and execute technical migration strategies by working with highly technical teams         Ability to work with large scale network, compute, and storage architectures to help remove roadblocks in customer migration projects         Ability to engage with development, infrastructure, security, and IT operations teams at the customer and identifying repeatable patterns and architectures for cloud migration         Ability to drive the co-development of new go-to-market approaches and opportunities.         Ability to identify platform improvements, influencing future iterations of the AWS platform

column2: Automation Strategy:    Develop and execute an automation strategy that leverages emerging technologies like robotic process automation (RPA), machine learning, and artificial intelligence to streamline and optimize business processes.       Establish IT Architecture Practice:    Assist in establishing an IT Architecture practice and promote the adoption of architecture and standards methodologies with a focus on automation and digital transformation.       Solution Lifecycle Management:    Oversee activities related to solution ideation, design, and implementation with an emphasis on incorporating automation solutions where applicable.       Solution Vision and Roadmap:    Define the vision and requirements for solutions, recommending options that may include automation solutions. Develop a roadmap that integrates automation technologies.       Stakeholder Communication:    Effectively communicate the architecture, including automation components, to stakeholders. Collaborate with domain architects to ensure automation aligns with IT standards and procedures.       Structured Approach:    Advocate for a structured approach to business application solutions, emphasizing the integration of automation technologies to improve efficiency and productivity.       Solution Architecture Program:    Contribute to the development of a solutions architecture program that includes automation-driven projects and initiatives.       Standards Adherence:    Ensure that automation solutions align with technology standards and guidelines, and influence changes to standards when necessary to accommodate new automation technologies.       Financial Management:    Assist domain architecture teams in managing the timing and allocation of financial resources for automation projects, considering ROI and cost-effectiveness.       Support for Application Projects:    Provide architectural support for all application projects, including automation-focused projects, within peer IT portfolios.       Technology Evaluation:    Direct the identification and recommendation of appropriate automation solutions, evaluating their potential for improving productivity, usability, and total cost of ownership.       Proactive Solutions:    Develop and execute automation solutions that proactively address business challenges and reduce the time spent on reactive work.       Security Analysis:    Provide analysis of security protection technologies specific to automation technologies to ensure data and processes remain secure.   Knowledge and Skills Required      Communication:    Excellent oral and written communication skills to convey complex technical concepts, including automation strategies and technologies, to non-technical stakeholders.       Analytical and Problem-Solving:    Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities with a focus on applying automation to address IT challenges effectively.       Attention to Detail:    High attention to detail, especially regarding accounting skills, to assess automations impact accurately.       Independence:    Ability to work under indirect supervision, making independent decisions regarding automation strategies and implementation.       IT Expertise:    Broad understanding of information technology topics, including emerging automation technologies, to inform architectural decisions.       Interpersonal Skills:    Effective interpersonal skills and a collaborative management style, with a focus on teamwork and team building in an automation-driven environment.       Adaptability:    Comfortable with ambiguity and willing to acquire new skills, particularly related to emerging automation technologies, in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.       Creativity:    A technically creative and open-minded approach to solving complex IT problems, including through the innovative use of automation.

column2: As a Cloud Solution Architect specializing in Azure Infrastructure, you will play a key role in designing and implementing cloud solutions for our organizations infrastructure needs. You will leverage your expertise in Microsoft Azure to architect scalable, secure, and reliable solutions that meet business requirements. The role involves collaboration with cross-functional teams, providing technical leadership, and ensuring the successful delivery of cloud-based infrastructure projects.       Job Description:         Solution Design:         Architect and design Azure infrastructure solutions based on business and technical requirements.     Develop scalable and cost-effective cloud architectures, considering factors such as performance, security, and compliance.         Technical Leadership:         Provide technical leadership and guidance to development and operations teams.     Collaborate with stakeholders to understand project goals and translate them into actionable technical plans.         Implementation:         Lead the implementation of Azure infrastructure solutions, ensuring adherence to best practices and industry standards.     Work closely with development and operations teams to deploy and optimize cloud-based systems.         Security and Compliance:         Design and implement security measures to safeguard cloud environments.     Ensure compliance with industry regulations and organizational policies.         Troubleshooting and Support:         Provide support for Azure infrastructure-related issues, troubleshooting and resolving them in a timely manner.     Collaborate with support teams to ensure the stability and reliability of cloud environments.         Documentation:         Create comprehensive documentation for implemented solutions, configurations, and best practices.     Train and mentor team members on Azure infrastructure technologies.         Continuous Improvement:         Stay abreast of the latest Azure services, features, and best practices.     Proactively identify opportunities for improvement in existing architectures and processes.               Qualifications:         Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.     Proven experience as a Cloud Solution Architect with a focus on Azure Infrastructure.     In-depth knowledge of Azure services, including compute, storage, networking, and security.     Strong understanding of infrastructure as code (IaC) and configuration management tools.     Experience with containerization and orchestration tools such as Docker and Kubernetes.     Familiarity with DevOps practices and tools.     Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.               Certifications   :     Relevant certifications such as        Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect Expert,      Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate, or similar.               Preferred Experience:         Experience in migrating on-premises infrastructure to Azure, designing hybrid cloud solutions, and implementing disaster recovery strategies.             Benefits:         Competitive salary with performance-based bonuses.     Comprehensive training program.     Health Insurance benefits.     Opportunities for professional growth and advancement.     Friendly and collaborative work environment.     Based on Performance you will have the opportunity to work on-site               Desired Attributes:         Were on the hunt for driven individuals with a fervent passion and a readiness to go above and beyond. We value those eager to learn, grow, and contribute significantly to the expansion of ATCs Cloud division.             Seeking dynamic go-getters with a proactive mindset.

column2: Job Description Job Summary   We are seeking an experienced and highly skilled AWS Cloud and IT Infrastructure Architect to lead the design, implementation, and optimization of our cloud and IT infrastructure. The ideal candidate will possess deep expertise in Amazon Web Services (AWS), coupled with a strong understanding of overall IT infrastructure architecture.  While we need a  cloud architect , we also need candidate to have a good knowledge on  infrastructure   components such as Storage, Backup, Network,  VMware, Unix, Data center. Years of experience needed ??9 ??14 years. Technical Skills:  1.  Cloud Architecture Design: Develop comprehensive AWS cloud architecture solutions that align with business objectives and requirements. Design and implement scalable, secure, and high-performance cloud infrastructure to meet current and future needs. 2.  Infrastructure Planning and Optimization: Assess existing IT infrastructure and propose optimizations for migration to the cloud. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand infrastructure requirements and plan for capacity, performance, and cost optimization. 3.  AWS Services Implementation: Implement and configure AWS services, including but not limited to EC2, S3, RDS, Lambda, VPC, IAM, and others, based on best practices and security standards. 4.  Security and Compliance: Develop and implement security best practices for AWS environments, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations. Conduct regular security audits and implement measures to safeguard data and applications. 5.  Monitoring and Automation: Implement monitoring and alerting solutions for cloud infrastructure. Develop and deploy automation scripts and tools to streamline operational tasks and improve efficiency. 6.  Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity: Design and implement robust disaster recovery and business continuity solutions for cloud-based applications and services. 7.  Collaboration and Communication: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including development, operations, and security, to ensure the successful delivery of cloud solutions. Communicate effectively with technical and non-technical stakeholders, providing guidance and recommendations. 8.  Documentation: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for cloud architecture, configuration, and procedures. Ensure that documentation is up-to-date and accessible to relevant team members. 9.  Infrastructure Planning and Design: Develop comprehensive infrastructure architecture plans aligning with business objectives and technology requirements. Design and document solutions for data centers, networks, servers, storage, and related infrastructure components. 10.  Technology Evaluation: Evaluate new and emerging technologies to determine their potential impact on the organization's infrastructure. Conduct feasibility studies and cost-benefit analyses for adopting new technologies. 11.  Capacity Planning: Assess current and future capacity needs of the infrastructure and plan for scalability. Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business growth projections and align infrastructure accordingly. 12.  Security Architecture: Design and implement security architecture for the entire IT infrastructure. Develop and enforce security policies, standards, and procedures. 13.  Network Architecture: Design and optimize network architecture, including WAN, LAN, and wireless networks. Collaborate with network engineers to ensure efficient and secure data flow. 14.  Server and Storage Architecture: Architect server environments, including virtualization and containerization solutions. Design storage solutions considering performance, redundancy, and scalability. 15.  Participate in P1/P2 outages and help team when needed. Management Skills: Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex issues. Good team player 10+ years of experience (Level 7) Qualifications: Bachelor?? degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field. Master's degree is a plus.  Certifications Needed:  AWS Certified Solutions Architect Professional or equivalent certifications are required. Additional certifications such as AWS Certified DevOps Engineer or AWS Certified Security Specialty are highly desirable. Interested Candidate can send their CV to "arya.suresh@mphasis.com" with Subject line as "AWS Cloud Architect"

column2: Response Informatics is looking for AWS Solution Architect to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey     The AWS Solution Architect will play a critical role in designing, implementing, and managing innovative cloud solutions for our clients utilizing AWS services     The ideal candidate will possess a deep understanding of cloud architecture, AWS services, and best practices to deliver high-quality solutions that meet our clients' business needs     Key Responsibilities:Cloud Solution Design:Collaborate with clients to understand their technical requirements, business objectives, and design custom AWS-based solutions that address their needs     Design scalable, cost-effective, and highly available architectures using AWS services while considering security, performance, and reliability     Create architectural diagrams, documentation, and presentations to effectively communicate proposed solutions to clients and internal stakeholders     Technical Implementation:Implement and configure AWS services to build robust and scalable cloud solutions according to the designed architecture     Migrate on-premises applications to the AWS cloud, following best practices and minimizing downtime     Optimize and troubleshoot existing AWS deployments to improve performance, security, and cost-efficiency     Cloud Infrastructure Management:Manage and maintain AWS resources, including instances, databases, networking components, and security mechanisms     Monitor the health and performance of AWS applications and infrastructure, proactively addressing issues and ensuring high availability     Implement automation and infrastructure-as-code (IAC) practices to streamline deployments and reduce manual tasks     Security and Compliance:Implement security best practices and standards to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of data and applications in the AWS environment     Perform security assessments, audits, and compliance checks to ensure AWS solutions meet industry-specific regulations and guidelines     Client Collaboration:Engage with clients to gather requirements, provide technical guidance, and address concerns throughout the project lifecycle     Act as a technical advisor to clients, offering insights and recommendations for optimizing their AWS infrastructure and applications     Technical Leadership:Mentor and guide junior team members in AWS best practices, architecture design, and implementation     Stay up-to-date with the latest AWS services, trends, and industry developments, and share knowledge with the team and clients

column2: This would suit a Solution Architect with a background in complex designs around transformation from legacy to cloud, and who is looking to work on fast moving projects. A strong background in software development is preferred and proven track record in delivering projects is required.     The role requires attendance at business-facing and technical senior stakeholder meetings to present and explain why designs have been chosen, so good communication planning skills are essential, with the ability to put things into non-technical terms for the wider audience.         Key Skills Experience           Proven experience in architecting solutions, with a significant focus on collaboration with software development teams to implement best practices and current architectural standards.         Establish governance on best practices for cloud usage. Work closely with development teams to address technical challenges, optimize cloud usage, and ensure adherence to cloud architecture standards.         Proficiency in creating comprehensive technical specifications, system architecture diagrams, and other relevant documentation to guide the development and implementation process of cloud solutions.         Hands-on experience in prototyping cloud solutions.         Demonstrate strong capabilities in eliciting and analysing technical requirements beyond the initial draft. Work closely with stakeholders, including business users, product owners, and development teams, to understand the objectives and underlying business needs driving the cloud solution.         Excellent Communication Planning skills with the ability to collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders.         A proactive and results-driven mindset, with a passion for keeping up-to-date with the latest cloud technologies and trends.         Good conceptual design knowledge of:         Cloud Technologies: A deep understanding of the various cloud computing models and cloud services offered by major cloud providers but especially AWS including AWS Aurora, API Gateway, ECS, DMS, DynamoDB, Lambda, Load Balancing, S3, SNS/SQS etc.         Architectural Patterns: Proficiency in designing scalable, fault-tolerant, and highly available architectures. This includes knowledge of microservices, serverless computing, event-driven architectures, and distributed systems.         Performance Optimization: Skills in optimizing cloud-based applications for performance, scalability, and cost-effectiveness. This involves choosing appropriate instance types, load balancing strategies, and caching mechanisms.         Security: Knowledge of cloud security best practices, data encryption, identity management, and compliance requirements. Understanding how to secure cloud environments and applications against potential threats.         Cost Management: Ability to manage and optimize cloud costs, including resource provisioning, rightsizing, and utilization tracking.         AWS Solution Architect Certification           Desirable Skills Experience           Understanding of relational and NoSQL databases         DevOps and Automation: Proficiency in DevOps practices and automation tools.         Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery         Business Intelligence and Data Warehousing         Experience with agile development methodologies, enabling collaboration, and iterative improvements.         Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell) and automation tools to streamline cloud deployments and management tasks.         Experience with IaC principles and tools (e.g., Terraform, AWS CloudFormation) to provision and manage cloud resources programmatically.         Teams and other Microsoft office apps

column1: SAP End To End Solution Architect
column2: Primary Skill Lead SAP AD (Mainly new world SAP S/4) deals with global scope (5 to 25 M Euros), take end to end responsibility of entire SAP Solutioning, bid response by putting together and working with a solution team/SMEs. Appropriately position and promote Capgeminis SAP offers/assets in the opportunity context Drive the solution strategy by working with account team/sales/partners and shape the deals in tune with the competitive scenario, client priorities, technology suitability/viability with Support from Senior Solution Leaders in the team Defend developed solutions and offerings internally at the BU/MU/SBU level Plan, lead, present solution in client meetings/orals/workshops Interacting with customers, understanding the requirements, proposing solutions / methodology etc. Leading the New SAP (S/4HANA- OP/Cloud/Leonardo/AI-ML) adoption initiatives in the context of Digital Transformation in the customers journey, clearly demonstrating the business value. Drive innovation/transformation agenda in large existing accounts, provide delivery and solution assurance Support and guide solutions and offering in the Capability (COE)  Drive competency agenda and ideate new innovative solutions/PoCs/PoV''s Provide expert support to various projects and delivery engagements Guide, develop, mentor a team of architects and continuously drive Solutioning capability enhancement/improvement/industrialization/reusability/automation Secondary Skill Should have 12 + yrs of SAP exp, deep routed knowledge in area of expertise at least one FICO, O2C, P2P, SCM, CRM etc. and good SAP Solution Integration knowledge, should have worked in pre-sales. Pre-sales solution architect having experience in leading large strategic deals (>10ME) centred around SAP. Understanding business requirements and designing solutions along with estimation, costing and commercial offers to global customers. Strong hands-on experience in any one of the SAP core modules .g FICO, P2P, O2C, SCM, Technical streams (5 yrs), Delivery Management experience in SAP AD implementation projects (5 to 7 yrs.) in customer-facing roles, knowledge of S/4HANA, Suite on HANA and HANA database as a foundation is an added advantage. Experience in leading SAP projects in the AD side 3 M to 10 M Euros,  Expert understanding of overall process of implementation, migration, upgrade including sizing, architecture, configuration, management and day to day operation of SAP S/4HANA environment. Broad understanding across functional areas / in-depth process knowledge in one area. Industry knowledge/sector knowhow in Manufacturing/Retail/CPG/Life sciences Understands how business works, can articulate in business language and can translate solution/technology propositions into business value Experience in integrating SAP ERP solutions across other ERPs/SAP solutions  Experienced in a multi-cultural, multi-location distributed global delivery setup. Excellent communication skill in English. Additional language German/Spanish/Dutch or French is a big plus. Experienced in client interactions at Senior Level Program managers and Business process Managers  Very good capabilities and experience in people management and stake holder management. Experience in representing the practice/organization in industry events/forums  Educational Qualifications  BE/MBA / or equivalent education  Related SAP Certifications

column2: Project Role : Solution Architect Project Role Description : Own the overall solution blueprint and roadmap, work closely with clients to articulate business problems and translate them into an appropriate solution design. Must have skills : Solution Architecture Good to have skills : NA Minimum  12  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Full time education Job Title: Technology Solution Architect (System Integration and /or Application Managed Services)Purpose of the Job:The Solution Architect is responsible for supporting the Systems Integration (SI) and Application Managed Services (AMS) sales opportunities within Technology team(s) to ensure that solutions proposed to clients meet the client's needs and expectations, and can also be delivered in a reliable and predictable way within budget. This frequently requires balancing competing priorities, using innovative commercial and technical approaches to minimise risk and to meet challenging business cases. This means that the Solution Architect needs to demonstrate creativity and soft skills in driving consensus and alignment across multiple stakeholders, as well as more traditional technical, project management and commercial skills to arrive at optimum best fit solution response. The Solution Architect needs to act as a single point of contact (SPOC) for the opportunity throughout the sales process. This involves coordinating between Technology, Industry, Bid team, Global Delivery teams, other solution architect(s), subject matter experts (SME's), reviewers and approvers to ensure a winning, differentiated, deliverable and approved solution.Primary Responsibilities Engage with appropriate Accenture organisation areas to fully leverage the right assets and offerings, across capability groups when pursuing opportunities.  Understand and translate buyer values and requirements into the solution approach, leveraging standard processes, methods, deliverables, and the right mix of offerings.  Define a differentiated solution that achieves the greatest value (using Accenture's best practices) for the client and meets the client business case, delivering value, with a high level of confidence about the solution.  Manage the interface with the Technology sales team during the sales process and Delivery by ensuring regular communication and close collaboration with the sales team. Provide input to the sales team on how the solution may influence the sales campaign, pricing, risks and assumptions and negotiation strategy.  Lead/Participate in a team to plan, execute and manage the solution in response to a client requirement/RFP. This involves the coordination of various stakeholders across sales, delivery and CGs. Participate and/or lead solution discussions and client meetings related to technology solution or platform(s) (SAP S/4 or Oracle cloud or Salesforce, etc.) differentiation solution proposed to the client.  Shape the commercial proposition by working with finance team / commercial team or other responsible areas to develop the underlying economics of the solution.  Work with Legal and Commercial teams to ensure use of standards and adherence for internal compliance. Collaborate with the legal advisors to provide input to contractual Terms and Conditions. Manage solution risk assessment through active issue management and risk mitigation.  Contribute to Solution specific content for Response or Proposal material. Support creation of (and review) contract schedules. Obtain the necessary signoff and compliance of the solution with proper input from the Technology and Delivery Leads on client business objectives, industry, risk assessment, budget, and preferences. Lead and/or participate discussions around Client Value Creation, Innovation, Solution Differentiation and provide solution details during orals / client workshop sessions. Confirm artifacts developed during the Solutioning and ensure they are uploaded according to the defined processe(s). Effectively transition the Solution Plan to the appropriate teams within the Delivery Platforms, including Service Delivery and Mobilisation.Skills and Capabilities Ability to build trusted relationships with Client CXOs/SVPs Eco-system partners. Excellent oral and written communication skills. Independence and self-motivation. Ability to coordinate a distributed and diverse team. Attention to detail attitude. Knowledge and experience in financial analysis and costing.  Industry-specific solution knowledge and knowledge (ability to build knowledge) of Accenture offerings, assets and capabilities (recommended).Professional experience and other requirements 10+ years of experience in the Information Technology industry, with minimum experience of technology consulting, technology solutioning, technology sales in application services (system integration, application outsourcing, cloud advisory) experience.  At-least 5 years of extensive selling/pre-sales/solutioning experience in client proximity. Experience in developing Statements of Work / Project Charters / Contract Schedules (recommended) Experience and Knowledge of different commercial Structures and deal shapes (recommended) Solution planning and configuration experience (recommended) Industry exposure (at least in one industry) in driving business value through consultative approach and thought leadership Willingness to be mobile and meet client travel requirements Willingness to work flexible hours to meet proposal deadlinesAdditional Info :

column2: Project Role : Solution Architect Project Role Description : Translate client requirements into differentiated, deliverable solutions using in-depth knowledge of a technology, function, or platform. Collaborate with the Sales Pursuit and Delivery Teams to develop a winnable and deliverable solution that underpins the client value proposition and business case.  Must have skills : Solution Architecture Good to have skills : NA Minimum  15  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Full time education Summary :As a Solution Architect, you will be responsible for owning the overall solution blueprint and roadmap, working closely with clients to articulate business problems and translate them into an appropriate solution design. Your typical day will involve collaborating with cross-functional teams, analyzing business requirements, and designing solutions that meet client needs. column2: JOB DESCRIPTION About us PERSOLKELLY (APAC- MNC), a leader in providing end-to-end workforce solutions serving clients and job seekers for Search, selection, and Staffing solutions across industries. Further to the shared, below is a snapshot of the role description and details. RoleDigital Solution Architect CMS Magento Reporting toHead Functions Service LineExperience Platform Experience : 10+ Years Work Location : Any of our Business Locations (Coimbatore, Hyderabad, Gurgaon and Bangalore) Job Type: Hybrid  Mode: Full-Time Purpose of the Role: The Digital Solution Architect role within the Experience Platform service line is multi-faceted and critical to the success of our organization. Domain & Technology Expertise Experience working in any 2 or more, Digital Experience platform technologies like Adobe, Sitecore, Drupal and Digital Commerce Platforms like Salesforce, Stripe etc or similar. Functional experience in architecting digital and multi-channel technology solutions, covering all layers of the technology stack, from presentation through to physical infrastructure confirming architectural principles. Outline current and future vision architecture, including traceability from business and IT strategies to suggested technologies. Good knowledge of Cloud technologies and their integration with Experience Platforms Knowledge of Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, personalization and optimizations. Digital solution Architect role.  Skills required : profile who has done at least one implementation in CMS(any platform- AEM, Drupal etc) , at least one in Commerce( Adobe , Sitecore, Salesforce), Cloud and devops knowledge(AWS/Azure), Adobe Analytics. No technical manager/Program Manager role. Job Responsibilities: Ownership and accountable for overall solutions and quality for Service line: Responsible for overseeing all aspects related to the technology solutions provided within the Experience Platform service line. This implies that the person has full responsibility over designing, reviewing solutions, implementation, and maintenance. Ensure that the solutions meet high standards of performance, reliability, scalability and customer satisfaction. Enforces standards: Establishing and maintaining standards and best practices within the service line ensuring that all solutions adhere to these standards, which may include technical specifications, design principles, regulatory requirements, and quality assurance processes. Actively monitor compliance with these standards and take corrective action when necessary to maintain consistency and quality across all offerings. Capability and Thought leadership influence: Play a significant role in driving capability and thought leadership within the service line that include skills, expertise, and competencies needed to deliver innovative and effective solutions. Actively contribute to industry knowledge and best practices and inspire and guide others, both internally and externally, to adopt new ideas and approaches. Develop accelerators for business growth. Sales support for strategic accounts: Provide support to sales efforts, particularly for key strategic accounts or clients. This includes understanding client needs, developing customized solutions, and articulating value propositions. Build and maintain strong client relationships, drive revenue growth, and ensure alignment between sales strategies and service line capabilities Interested & Eligible candidates can directly share CV on Priyanka_sinha@persolkelly.com along with the below details.   Current location:  Total Exp Current CTC; fixed n variable Expected CTC Offer CTC if you have Reason for Change/Quit Total Notice Period (Negotiable or not)  Please mentioned your total exp in below skills ;   Magento Drupal PHP Java based CMS Cloud  Devops Design Solutions Craft cms By submitting your job application, you consent to the collection, use, and disclosure of your personal data in line with our Privacy Policy. You can withdraw consent, modify your data, or report grievances by emailing our designated Consent Manager at dpo_in@persolkelly.com from your registered email address. We prioritize your privacy. PERSOLKELLY India does not charge fees or request payments from job seekers. Visit https://www.persolkelly.co.in/beware-of-job-scams/ for more information and report suspicious requests to contactus_in@persolkelly.com. Create dashboards, systems, tools & processes that will enhance our clients support and operations ? Our customer list is full of fantastic global brands and leaders who love what we build for them. Collaborative Environment:  You Can expand your skills by collaborating with a diverse team of highly talented people in an open, laidback environment ??or even abroad in one of our global centers or client facilities! Professional Development:  Our dedicated Learning & Development team regularly organizes Communication skills training(GL Vantage, Toast Master),Stress Management program, professional certifications, and technical and soft skill trainings. Excellent Benefits:  We provide our employees with competitive salaries, family medical insurance, Group Term Life Insurance, Group Personal Accident Insurance , NPS(National Pension Scheme ), Periodic health awareness program, extended maternity leave, annual performance bonuses, and referral bonuses. column2: Project Role : Cloud Platform Architect Project Role Description : Oversee application architecture and deployment in cloud platform environments -- including public cloud, private cloud and hybrid cloud. This can include cloud adoption plans, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring.  Must have skills : Google Cloud Platform Architecture Good to have skills : API Management, Google Kubernetes Engine Minimum  7.5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : Total 15 years of full time education Summary :As a Cloud Platform Architect, you will be responsible for overseeing application architecture and deployment in cloud platform environments, including public cloud, private cloud, and hybrid cloud. Your typical day will involve designing cloud adoption plans, managing and monitoring cloud applications, and ensuring cloud application design meets business requirements.  Roles & Responsibilities: Lead the design and implementation of cloud adoption plans, including public cloud, private cloud, and hybrid cloud environments. Oversee the design of cloud applications, ensuring they meet business requirements and align with the overall cloud adoption plan. Manage and monitor cloud applications, ensuring they are performing optimally and meeting service level agreements. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure cloud applications are integrated with other systems and meet security and compliance requirements. Stay up-to-date with the latest advancements in cloud technology, including Google Cloud Platform Architecture, Google Kubernetes Engine, and API Management. Professional & Technical Skills: Must To Have Skills:Expertise in Google Cloud Platform Architecture. Good To Have Skills:Experience with Google Kubernetes Engine and API Management. Strong understanding of cloud adoption plans, cloud application design, and cloud management and monitoring. Experience with integrating cloud applications with other systems and ensuring security and compliance requirements are met. Solid grasp of cloud technology advancements, including Google Cloud Platform Architecture, Google Kubernetes Engine, and API Management. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 7.5 years of experience in Google Cloud Platform Architecture. The ideal candidate will possess a strong educational background in technology and information architectures, along with a proven track record of delivering impactful cloud-based solutions. This position is based at our Bengaluru office. Qualification Total 15 years of full time education

column2: A Solution Architect is responsible for designing and implementing end-to-end solutions that meet the business and technical requirements of an organization.     Architecture: Develop and maintain the architecture of the solution, including the infrastructure, applications, data, and security components.     Technology Evaluation: Evaluate new and existing technologies to determine their suitability for the solution and make recommendations for adoption.     Prototyping: Develop prototypes or proof-of-concept implementations to validate the design and identify potential issues.     Documentation: Document the solution architecture, including diagrams, specifications, and other relevant documentation.     Technical Leadership: Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams, ensuring that the solution is implemented according to the design.
column11: Technical Solution Architect

column2: ***Please Note: This is a 100% Work From Office role. People looking for Work From Home or Hybrid must strictly not apply.   Location: Noida Work Timings: 12 pm - 9 pm (Mon-Fri) Position Summary  We are seeking highly accomplished  .Net Full Stack & Azure   Architect  who can be the part of the GEDU IT Engineering Team at  GEDU  Noida. The person should preferably have worked as Architect in any Software Product development organization and has experience in Agile Software Development using methodologies like Scrum, Lean and SAFe etc. and delivering scalable  Web/Mobile/SaaS/Cloud Products in Agile methodology .    An ideal Architect at Gedu will be someone who has moved from the position of .Net Developer to .Net Solution Architect and then .Net solution Architect to Enterprise Architect role.  Architect should be able to understand the business need for different Products and provide his recommendations in terms of architecture and right tools. He should be able to review and provide comment on the code written by Developers. Also, he should be able to suggest coding standards and inculcate the best practices within the team. He should be able to partner with Infrastructure and technology team to recommend productivity tool, enterprise level security practices, Scalability and other global standards. Duties and Responsibilities: Lead the development of the Enterprise Architecture guard-rails, strategy, and roadmap and ensure integration with the overall IT and enterprise strategic plans through coordination management. Hands on candidate in creating POCs and applications to showcase and create templates for the development team to adopt and follow. column2: We are seeking a talented and experienced Solution Architect to join our team      As a Solution Architect, you will play a critical role in designing and implementing sophisticated solutions for our clients      You will work closely with clients, project managers, and development teams to ensure that our solutions align with business goals and technical requirements              Experience:        8 10 years of Experience        Employment Type:    Full Time, Permanent.        Qualifications:          Bachelor s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field. Master s degree preferred.          Proven experience as a Solution Architect in designing and implementing advanced and sophisticated software solutions.          Strong knowledge of architecture patterns, design principles, and best practices.          Proficiency in one or more programming languages and a solid understanding of software development methodologies.          Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.          Experience with the cloud computing platform AWS is a must.          Experience with cloud computing platforms (e.g. Azure, Google Cloud) is a plus.          Relevant certifications (e.g. AWS Certified Solutions Architect, TOGAF) are advantageous.            Responsibilities:            Solution Design:    Collaborate with clients and internal teams to understand business objectives and technical requirements. Design end-to-end solutions that meet these needs, considering scalability, security, and performance.            Architecture Documentation:    Create detailed solution architecture documents, including system diagrams, data flow diagrams, and technical specifications. Ensure documentation is comprehensive and easily understandable by development teams.            Technology Evaluation:    Stay up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends. Evaluate and recommend technologies and tools that can enhance the effectiveness of our solutions.            Technical Leadership:    Provide technical leadership and guidance to development teams throughout the project lifecycle. Ensure that the solution is developed according to the architectural design and best practices.            Risk Assessment:    Identify potential risks and challenges in the solution design and propose mitigation strategies. Proactively address technical issues to minimize project disruptions.            Client Engagement:    Build and maintain strong relationships with clients. Present and explain the technical aspects of solutions to clients, addressing their questions and concerns.            Quality Assurance:    Collaborate with quality assurance teams to develop testing strategies and ensure that the solution meets quality standards and performance benchmarks.

Key Responsibilities:                     1. Solution Design: Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and architect comprehensive monitoring solutions encompassing application performance, infrastructure health, and user experience monitoring.                 2. Technology Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend APM and observability tools, platforms, and frameworks suited to the unique requirements of Birlasoft clients, with a focus on scalability, flexibility, and seamless integration.                 3. Implementation: Lead the implementation of monitoring solutions, configuring monitoring agents, establishing dashboards and alerts, and seamlessly integrating with existing systems and workflows.                 4. Performance Optimization: Analyze performance data to identify bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and areas for improvement, collaborating with development teams to implement performance optimizations.                 5. Troubleshooting: Act as a subject matter expert in troubleshooting performance and availability issues, utilizing monitoring tools and diagnostic techniques to swiftly identify root causes and recommend corrective actions.                 6. Proof of Concept (PoC): Lead PoC initiatives for APM solutions, specifically AppDynamics and Dynatrace, to evaluate their effectiveness and alignment with Birlasofts AIOps strategies.                 7. Documentation and Training: Develop comprehensive documentation, best practices, and training materials to empower teams in effectively utilizing and maintaining the monitoring infrastructure.                 8. Continuous Improvement: Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies in APM and observability, proactively identifying opportunities to enhance monitoring capabilities and drive operational excellence within Birlasofts AIOps initiatives.                     Qualifications:                     - Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.             - Proven experience in solution architecture, with a focus on APM, observability, or related areas.             - Demonstrated experience leading Proof of Concept (PoC) initiatives for APM solutions, specifically AppDynamics and Dynatrace.             - Strong understanding of software development methodologies, IT operations, and cloud computing platforms.             - Proficiency in APM and observability tools such as AppDynamics, Dynatrace, New Relic, Datadog, Splunk, ELK stack, etc.             - Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to troubleshoot complex technical issues.             - Effective communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to interact with stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
column11: Computer science, Solution architecture, Cloud computing, Operational excellence, Analytical, Troubleshooting, IT operations, Continuous improvement, Solution Architect, Monitoring

column2: A career in our Advisory Acceleration Centre is the natural extension of PwC s leading class global delivery capabilities     We provide premium, cost effective, high quality services that support process quality and delivery capability in support for client engagements     As a Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution         PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:         Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.     Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.     Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.     Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.     Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.     Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.     Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.     Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.     Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                 About the Role   :             You'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution. Follow tasks to their logical conclusion and make sure that everything has been done to the right standard             Provide inputs on the development of design, implementation, operations, user guides, and training materials             Provide responsive advice, counsel, education and service concerning IT issues and trends in the IT industry. Mentor team members in technical topics             Maintain knowledge and understanding of current and emerging technologies, equipment and systems. Review and provide input standard operating procedures             Collaborate with other technical and non-technical team members, clients, and vendors to define, build, and deliver solutions             Required Qualifications:             12+ years of full-time years of IT experience; Prior consulting, Professional Services and/or Enterprise Experience preferred. 6+ years of experience in cloud implementation and architecture             Experience in major cloud technologies including virtualization, containers, networking, etc on AWS             Experience with fundamental storage concepts: filesystems, backup, cloning, snapshotting, logical volume management, disk encryption             A proven record of success in implementing and leading large scale cloud platform development or enterprise-wide scalable and high-availability operations in a cloud environment             Expertise across cloud computing, infrastructure, IT operations, applications, data management, and cloud governance models with ability to advise on industry-leading approaches             Knowledge in hardware virtualization (servers, storage, and networks), grid computing, internet security protocols and standards, application, integration, and data architecture             Experience in DevOps, Agile, and Scrum constructs - Developing strategies and approaches to optimize the implementation of cloud resources and capabilities             Experience in designing and developing microservices architecture             Hands on experience with AWS Services like VPC, EC2, S3, ELB, RDS, ECS/EKS, IAM, CloudFront, CloudWatch, SQS/SNS, Lambda             Knowledge of appropriate cloud services to design and deploy architecture and applications based on given customer and/or Solutions Architect s requirements.             Ability to apply DevOps including IaaC using Terraform / CloudFormation, configuration management using Chef / Ansible, CI/CD using Jenkins / CodeDeploy, etc to incrementally automate, modernize, and improve customers environments             Understand cloud security controls, auditing capabilities network boundary controls, and related toolsets; and compliant environments including PCI, HIPAA, etc                 Experience in performing migrations to a cloud environment leveraging tools similar to CloudEndure, AWS Database Migration Service, etc                 Experience in various database engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, MongoDB             Experience in developing software in two or more of the following languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C#, Node.js, Typescript, etc             Experience in containerization using Docker or Kubernetes, preferably in a cloud environment and leveraging Git or other source control methodology                         Minimum Education Required:     Bachelor s degree (BE, B Tech, MCA, M Tech or equivalent)             Certification(s) Preferred   :    One or more Architect certifications from AWS

column2: Project Role : Infrastructure Architect Project Role Description : Lead the definition, design and documentation of technical environments. Deploy solution architectures, conduct analysis of alternative architectures, create architectural standards, define processes to ensure conformance with standards, institute solution-testing criteria, define a solutions cost of ownership, and promote a clear and consistent business vision through technical architectures.  Must have skills : Microsoft Teams Infrastructure Good to have skills : NA Minimum  5  year(s) of experience is required Educational Qualification : BE BSc or equivalent Summary :As the Team Leader for Microsoft Teams, candidate will play a pivotal role in leading a team of associates and junior resources tasked with managing and optimizing Microsoft Teams platform, with a specific focus on integrating enterprise voice capabilities. candidate will provide technical leadership and guidance to ensure the successful adoption and utilization of Microsoft Teams across organizations.  Roles & Responsibilities: Assist in the design, implementation, and administration of Microsoft Teams, including configuration of channels, chat, meetings, and collaboration features. Support the integration of enterprise voice capabilities into Microsoft Teams, including configuration of Direct Routing, calling plans, voice routing policies, and emergency services. Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and implement solutions to ensure optimal uptime and performance of Microsoft Teams services. Assist in implementing and managing security measures, such as data loss prevention (DLP), to safeguard sensitive information shared within Microsoft Teams. Develop and maintain documentation, policies, and procedures related to Microsoft Teams administration and usage. Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and new features of Microsoft Teams to support continuous improvement efforts. Provide technical support and guidance to end-users, including responding to inquiries and resolving issues related to Microsoft Teams. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance knowledge and skills related to Microsoft Teams administration. Professional & Technical Skills: 8-9 years of experience in managing and administering Microsoft Teams in an enterprise environment. Strong understanding of enterprise voice concepts and technologies, including Session Initiation Protocol (SIP), VoIP, and PSTN connectivity. Experience with configuring Direct Routing, calling plans, voice routing policies, and emergency services in Microsoft Teams. Administration and configuration of Microsoft Teams, including channels, chat, meetings, and collaboration features. Support the onboarding and offboarding of users within Microsoft Teams, including managing user accounts, permissions, and access controls. Implementation and configuration of Microsoft Teams governance policies, compliance features, and security controls. Monitor system performance, troubleshoot issues, and provide technical support to end-users, including resolving escalated issues and troubleshooting technical problems. Collaborate with IT teams to integrate Microsoft Teams with other systems and applications, such as Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, and third-party collaboration tools. Stay updated with industry trends, best practices, and new features of Microsoft Teams, evaluating their potential impact and contributing ideas for optimization. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance knowledge and skills related to Microsoft Teams administration and collaboration technologies. Development and maintenance of documentation, policies, and procedures related to Microsoft Teams administration and usage. Additional Information: The candidate should have a minimum of 8-9 years of experience in managing and administering Microsoft Teams in an enterprise environment. May need to work based on local time of the clients. Qualification BE BSc or equivalent

column2: The Solution Architect (SA) is part of the pre-sales team that ensures all solutions designed are customer focused, innovative, cost effective and meets or exceeded our customer s business needs     The solution design will include NCR and/or third-party solutions     The SA will work independently and/or in conjunction with NCR s hardware, software, procurement, vendors and other subject matter experts related to banking to arrive at the final winning solution design     The position will be based in India (metro location, preferably Mumbai), supporting the India subcontinent market, and will report to the APAC Regional SA leader                 KEY AREAS OF RESPONSIBILITY:           Creation of presales Solution Designs of Managed Services, as a Service and standalone services.         Analyse various cost elements of the solution, ensuring optimal balance of cost and effectivity of the solution in meeting customer needs.         Obtain all internal approvals before submission of proposals to customers.         Creation and negotiation of customer contracts until execution.         Ability to fit various services components/building blocks together to form services solutions that achieve business outcomes in alignment with customer requirements         Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to understand business goals and support services outcomes         Collaborate with various SMEs/3rd party vendors to arrive at optimized services solutions         Contribute to the effective management of risks and issues associated with solution designs                   BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:           10+ years of customer facing experience in a services design role including presales,         Experience in Managed Service and as a service frameworks         Ability to synthesise terms and conditions of an RFP/RFI/contract to derive models to emulate risks, penalties, revenue drivers etc. with or without the aid of historical performance data.         Commercial and contract expertise on multi-million-dollar opportunities with multiple technology and service layers         Bachelor s Degree         Experience designing Global or multi-region services preferred         Experience working with partners to build a service solution model         Demonstrates the ability to lead presales opportunities including service models, response contents, commercials, tactics, and negotiations         Strong ability to articulate the business value of Services and convince a customer of such value         Work with customers to pitch the most optimal solution in conjunction with sales and account management.         Deliver a well-defined set of service design documents articulating risks and mitigation techniques in a timely manner while presenting an end-to-end seamless service         Expertise in pre-sales and support strong qualification of opportunities, managing sales and customer expectations about what we can deliver         Experience on service cost models including as a SaaS model and creating innovative commercials, working with leasing partners as needed, to drive competitive advantage         Support producing new content including design templates, proposal documentation and presales slide materials         Comfortable delivering solution presentations to Customers         Strong understanding of Break/Fix, Managed Services and outsourcing solutions, applying sound ITIL concepts         ITIL certification and ISO20000 experience and/or accreditation (highly desirable)

column2: Immediate Requirement, preference will be given to those who are Immediately available or available on very short notice period Location:    Hybrid is preferred but we can consider Remote also for deserving candidates Job description This is an exciting opportunity to join and be a part of our rapidly growing Azure practice. Candidates must have strong experience in design and development using Azure Integration Services. column2: This Solution Architect is a functional and technical expert consulting with customers on implementing ServiceNow solutions based on best practices - all with the goal of accelerating adoption and driving customer business outcomes. The role requires the person to be laser-focused on solving for the most relevant customer challenges - providing leadership and support during sales cycles, on direct engagements with our Customers and partners, and advocating for customer needs within ServiceNow (e.g., Product Management, Leading Practices, Training & Certification).     Solution Architect brings architectural guidance, deep business acumen, along with deep product expertise, innovation, and knowledge capital to our customers and partners. This role requires a broad understanding of the ServiceNow platform, depth in understanding a complete Workflow of products (e.g. Technology Workflow) to allow the creation of mulit-product solutions that integrate with the customer s enterprise architecture.     The Solution Architect will engage a team of ServiceNow and channel partner resources and support sales cycles as required to grow overall wallet share and cross-sell. Understand the client s overall business to ensure successful implementation of ServiceNow products and technologies. Act as an authority on ServiceNow Expert Services project methodology and best practices, demonstrating the ability to tailor the methodology to meet the client s needs while preserving a structured process. Demonstrate high Speed of Delivery - being able to rapidly develop documentation, standards, and other deliverables for which they are responsible. Identify and pursue potential ServiceNow Expert Services opportunities at a client within and outside of the scope of work. Work with ServiceNow Sales, Solution Consulting, ACE partners, Servicenow Services Sellers and others to qualify, manage and close expert services opportunities. Collaborate with ServiceNow Sales to use Expert Services resources and service offerings in the most appropriate fashion to support large/strategic product sales opportunities.      The Solution Architect will work alongside the Services Sellers in the sales process and then maintain periodic touch points during delivery activities to ensure that the architecture and design principles are maintained, being a consistent trusted partner for the customer.     The Solution Architect will work on the largest digital transformation opportunities with our most strategic customers engaging with C-Levels roles not only within IT but also various business functions.          What you get to do in this role:         Support pre-sales activities like conducting sales presentations, leading solutioning/scoping discussions/workshops, estimating consulting engagement efforts in partnership with Services Account Executives (SAE), Solution Sales Executives/Consultants, Sales Account Executives, and Partner Sales Organizations     Build credibility/trust with core Customer account teams to ensure they engage with Customer Outcomes (CO) early in the deal lifecycle and so they are comfortable with CO leading pursuits and working with the customer on stand-alone Services deals.     Be a strong evangelist of the ServiceNow value proposition aligned to customers objectives.     Qualify customer opportunities in conjunction with the SAE.     Develop deep understanding of customer requirements and translate to a high level solution/scope/effort.     Grow deal size by becoming a Trusted Advisor for the customer and manage alignment with their strategy.     Provide continuity during the pre-sales process through engagement delivery.      Commercial awareness - business case input, understanding of customers budgetary constraints.     Write SoWs with a strong focus on pre-requisites and risk management.     Gain customer approval of the SoW scope and services description through multiple walk-throughs.     Engage with internal delivery resources to request specialist scoping support where required.     Bridge between the technical scope, architecture, and technical governance.     Build project roadmaps (e.g. phasing) aligned to customers capabilities and business objectives.     Be a lead member of an overall engagement project team focused on delivering successful and substantive customer outcomes, focused on inter-connectivity between Workflow solutions and a customer s technology landscape, while informing customer on governance best practices     Align delivery and Impact teams for scoped projects. Drive further license and services revenue by picking up gaps/further opportunities within the customer.     Support project initiation and planning activities to ensure seamless transition to delivery and that the agree architecture and design are respected through sales to delivery.     Become a part of the extended project governance team and attend check points and governance meetings.     Attend post-delivery reviews and project close out and ensure feedback is captured to refine/improve scoping.     Interlock with existing customer engaged teams, where present, to further understand where opportunities exist.     Enable and mentor other members of the ServiceNow delivery team and partner ecosystem.     Up to 50% travel annually, driven by customer needs and internal meetings.       To be successful in this role, we need someone who has:         An extensive career in Professional Services, ideally working also with a software OEM, and the value proposition they bring for a customer.     The a

column2: As a Cloud Oracle Database Migration Specialist, your primary responsibility will be to facilitate the migration of Oracle databases to cloud environments      This role requires expertise in Oracle database administration, cloud technologies, and migration methodologies      You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure a seamless transition to the cloud while maintaining data integrity, security, and optimal performance              Key Responsibilities:          Cloud Environment Assessment:Evaluate existing Oracle database environments to determine their suitability for migration to the cloud      Collaborate with stakeholders to understand business requirements and identify cloud service options that align with organizational goals      Migration Planning and Strategy:Develop and implement comprehensive migration plans, considering factors such as data volume, application dependencies, downtime constraints, and cloud provider specifications      Define migration strategies for different database components, such as schema, data, and configurations      Data Migration Execution:Execute database migrations to cloud platforms, ensuring data consistency, integrity, and security      Utilize cloud migration tools and technologies to optimize the process and minimize downtime      Cloud Platform Expertise:Demonstrate proficiency in the chosen cloud platform (eg, AWS, Azure, Google Cloud) and leverage platform-specific features for enhanced performance and scalability      Stay updated on the latest cloud technologies and best practices related to database migration      Performance Optimization:Identify and address performance issues during and post-migration, optimizing the database for cloud environments      Implement cloud-specific tuning strategies and recommendations      Documentation:Maintain detailed documentation of the migration process, configurations, and any issues encountered      Provide documentation to support training and knowledge transfer to the operations and support teams      Collaboration and Communication:Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including cloud architects, system administrators, developers, and project managers, to ensure a smooth migration process      Communicate effectively with stakeholders, providing updates on the progress, challenges, and resolutions throughout the migration project      Security and Compliance:Implement and enhance security measures in the cloud environment, ensuring compliance with industry standards and regulations      Collaborate with security teams to address and mitigate potential vulnerabilities              Requirements:              Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.      Proven experience as an Oracle Database Administrator with a focus on cloud migration.      Strong knowledge of Oracle database architecture, versions, and features.      Experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.Expertise in database migration tools and cloud-specific migration methodologies      .Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.      Strong communication and interpersonal skills.      Ability to adapt to changing cloud technologies and environments.              Certifications:              Oracle Certified Professional (OCP)Relevant cloud certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Database - Specialty, Azure Database Administrator Associate) would be advantageous.Note:      The responsibilities and requirements mentioned above are general guidelines, and specific duties and qualifications may vary based on the organization and the cloud platform chosen for migration.

column2: We are seeking a dynamic and experienced professional to join our organization as Senior Manager, People Technology. In this strategic leadership role, you will be responsible for overseeing the development, implementation, and optimization of technology solutions related to human resources.     The ideal candidate will be passionate about crafting an outstanding, user focused and scalable experience for our creators and managers through deep listening, understanding the technologies involved, and partnering with IT and other key stakeholders within Light & Wonder. The candidate will have demonstrated experience using technology and data to improve outcomes, leading teams, and partnering with others (e.g. IT, Sr. Leadership).     This role, reporting to the Sr Director of People Technology, is a people manager position, and will require managing a team of Workday functional and technical team members as well as providing mentoring and guidance of other team members.           RESPONSIBILITIES:                 Strategy and Direction         Combine business goals and employee needs to drive a product roadmap that fully utilizes the available technologies and serves our employees.     Understand our employees deeply through various listening mechanisms (e.g. surveys, research, focus groups, interviews, forums/councils) to build personas that allow us to best serve our diverse employee base.     Lead strategy to drive adoption and ease of use of Workday and self-service within various stakeholder groups.     Communicate direction and product priorities to the IT development team, other matrixed teams, and third-party partners.     Develop measurements to track activity, engagement, accuracy, and satisfaction with Workday.     Foster a culture of continuous learning and development within the People Technology teams.     Provide mentorship, guidance, and support to team members, promoting their professional growth and ensuring alignment with organizational objectives.         HR Technology Management         Oversee the implementation, optimization, and maintenance of HR technology systems, ensuring they meet the evolving needs of the organization.     Stay abreast of industry trends and emerging technologies to recommend and implement innovative solutions that enhance HR processes and employee experiences.     Serve as a system administrator for Workday Core HCM, Advanced Compensation, Benefits Security and Reporting and the go-to subject matter expert and provide technical leadership to People Capability Operations and Business teams in all aspects of the Workday HCM.     Participate and/or lead specific projects while working in an environment where we value Knowledge, Openness and Transparency.             People Analytics         Lead the development and implementation of a robust people analytics framework, leveraging data to provide insights into workforce trends, performance, and engagement.     Establish and track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to people analytics, providing regular reports to leadership for data-driven decision-making.         Compliance and Data Security         Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and data security standards in the management and utilization of HR data.     Implement and maintain policies and procedures to safeguard employee data privacy.         Delivery and Execution         Manage day-to-day operations for technology stack (e.g. backlog, sprint planning, analysis, testing)     Leadership of change management related to key initiatives, changes, and enhancements.     Development and maintenance of job aids, documentation, and ongoing communications.     Release management activities (e.g. testing, working with key stakeholders to adopt (or not) to-be-released functionality).     Manage day to day of reporting function (e.g. dashboards, requests, technology maintenance, key initiatives)     Leadership in data governance (e.g. data definitions and audits of key fields, business processes).     Identify and, at times, lead process improvements in areas most impactful to the employee/manager.         Partnership         Become a trusted partner for key internal stakeholders (e.g. People Operations, IT, People Business Partners) regarding Workday.     Act as a proponent of modern software development practices (e.g. agile).       Advocate for the employee and manager by empathizing with and understanding their needs.             Skills & Abilities           Strong analytical skills, problem solving and troubleshooting abilities.     Excellent written and verbal communication with a focus on documentation, and interpersonal skills.     Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment, especially with virtual geographically diverse teams.     Highly organized with the ability to multi-task and prioritize effectively while demonstrating a sense of urgency.

column2: Your experience and passion for IT infrastructure development will mean you will play a central role in the development and maintenance of Unilode Aviation Solutions Platforms. The Cloud Infrastructure Manager will develop and implement a strategic plan for the organizations IT infrastructure to align with business objectives and future growth.                 They will play a vital role in ensuring that the organizations IT infrastructure is robust, secure, and aligned with business goals. They are responsible for both daily operations and long-term strategic planning, ensuring that the infrastructure supports the organizations growth and technology needs while maintaining a high level of availability and security.                 This is a great opportunity for an individual to join us as a Cloud Infrastructure Manager, where you will be part of the Global IT Team, with the role being developed into our brand new site in Bangalore, India site.
