column2: As the Senior Solution Architect reporting to the Director Consulting, you will be integral to a team that excels in crafting innovative solutions for both new and existing clients     In this role, your primary focus will be on leveraging data to fuel the architecture and strategy of Digital Experience Platforms (DXP)     You will be instrumental in defining the technology and software architecture, with a special emphasis on how data-driven insights drive the design and implementation of client initiatives     Your expertise will guide the development of solutions that are heavily anchored in CMS, CDP, CRM, loyalty and analytics-intensive platforms, integrating ML and AI capabilities     The essence of our approach is centered around leveraging data, to create composable, insightful, and effective DXP solutions               You Are:          Client-Facing, often sitting face to face with prospective customers to shape technical and commercially viable solutions.     A Mentor, you lead by example and challenge others to push their boundaries.     A Self-Starter, you re an expert in your field but still eager to improve your skillset in the ever-evolving landscape of Omnichannel solutions.     Collaborative, you enjoy working with several cross functional teams on a daily basis.     An effective communicator, you have the charisma to command attention, strategize and problem-solve on your feet when needed with internal and external team members.     You have a mastery of written language, able to deliver compelling technical proposals to new and existing clients.             Your Key responsibilities:        Here s what you ll be doing day to day        Technical Solution Strategy: Discuss technical solutions with current clients, prospective clients and the internal team and provide innovative new ideas to create a functional and attractive digital environment. Contribute to our client s digital transformation strategies based on industry best practices. Participate as a subject matter expert in business development activities including but not limited to proposal writing and pitching in-person.     Cross Functional Collaboration: You will be closely engaged with product vendor partners, client partners, strategists, and delivery engagement leaders to shape solutions towards clients explicit and latent needs. You will assess and recommend experience platform-oriented solutions, engineering solutions, and closely collaborate with a global distributed delivery team to convert client visions to reality.     Architecting: Construct a technical architecture of multiple solutions fitting client s needs. Select and review technology frameworks, Identify, assess, and solve complex business problems through in-depth evaluation of variable factors.     Communicate: Articulate the transition from current to future state in consideration of the future needs of the business, security policies and requirements. Break down complex business and technical strategies and roadmaps into consumable requirements for teams to execute against.     Conceptualize: share knowledge and thought leadership to the rest of the organization, including recommendations on technical direction as well as team professional development. Research and present new technology trends     Estimation: participate in discovery of technical project requirements, scope and provide recommendations for phased program delivery. Create or contribute to project delivery estimations based on your recommendations and provide realistic level of effort estimations.             Your Experience & Intangible Traits:       The ideal candidate for the Solutions Architect position will possess the following competencies:       12+ years of experience in design, development, and support of large-scale web applications.     5+ years of experience developing modern applications using cloud-native abilities of AWS, GCP or Azure     5+ years of experience in design and implementation of efficient data architectures, storage solutions, and data processing workflows, with a focus on stream processing, event queuing capabilities, and advanced CI/CD pipelines     3+ years of hands-on experience of working with CDPs, data lakes and analytics solutions, which extend or integrate with digital experience platforms. Experience with tools like databricks, snowflake, mparticle, treasuredata, braze will be a plus     5+ years of hands-on experience implementing customer facing applications. Experience in content management systems like Drupal+Acquia, Sitecore, Contentstack, or Adobe Experience Manager, exposure to larger MarTech ecosystem, customer engagement and loyalty platforms will be a plus     5+ years of experience in client-facing technology consulting roles, understanding business needs, translating into solution to help businesses with customer acquisition, customer engagement & retention     3+ years of experience designing and/or implementing Commerce Tools, Magento, Shopify or similar E-Commerce platforms. Experience in headless commerce solutions and composable architecture is a plus.     Knowledge of current digital marketing trends and best practices on topics such as personalization, cross channel marketing, mobile, data driven optimization of experiences     Ability to define conceptual technology solution and articulate the value of technology to drive creative marketing platforms and present technology solutions to both technical and non-technical clients     Ability to methodically estimate technology execution scope of work in terms of budget and resources     Ability to leverage existing technology tools plus additionally research and apply new and experimental technologies to achieve business goals     Ability to translate client goals into achievable technical specifications     Bachelor s degree in computer engineering, computer science, management information systems, mathematics or equivalent       The statements contained in this job description reflect general details as necessary to describe the principal functions of this job, the level of knowledge and skill typically required and the scope of responsibility. It should not be considered an all-inclusive listing of work requirements. Individuals may perform other duties as assigned, including work in other functional areas to cover absences, to equalize peak work periods, or to otherwise balance organizational workload.
column11: Technical Architect, Computer science, Content management, CMS, Healthcare, Data processing, Adobe, Project delivery, Digital marketing, CRM

column2: The Databricks      AWS/Azure/GCP     Architect at Koantek builds secure, highly scalable big data solutions to achieve tangible, data-driven outcomes all the while keeping simplicity and operational effectiveness in mind. This role collaborates with teammates, product teams, and cross-functional project teams to lead the adoption and integration of the Databricks Lakehouse Platform into the enterprise ecosystem and AWS/Azure/GCP architecture. This role is responsible for implementing securely architected big data solutions that are operationally reliable, performant, and deliver on strategic initiatives.           Specific requirements for the role include:                Expert-level knowledge of data frameworks,      data lakes and open-source projects such as Apache Spark, MLflow, and Delta Lake               Expert-level hands-on coding experience in      Spark/Scala,Python or Pyspark               Expert proficiency in Python, C++, Java, R, and SQL               Mid-level knowledge of code versioning tools [such as Git, Bitbucket or SVN]               In depth understanding of Spark Architecture including Spark Core, Spark SQL, Data Frames, Spark Streaming, RDD caching, Spark MLib               IoT/event-driven/microservices in the cloud- Experience with private and public cloud architectures, pros/cons, and migration considerations.               Extensive hands-on experience implementing data migration and data processing using      AWS/Azure/GCP     services               Expertise in using Spark SQL with various data sources like JSON, Parquet and Key Value Pair               Extensive hands-on experience with the Technology stack available in the industry for data management, data ingestion, capture, processing, and curation:      Kafka, StreamSets, Attunity, GoldenGate, Map Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Hbase, Cassandra, Spark, Flume, Hive, Impala, etc.               Experience using Azure DevOps and CI/CD as well as Agile tools and processes including Git, Jenkins, Jira, and Confluence               Experience in creating tables, partitioning, bucketing, loading and aggregating data using Spark SQL/Scala               Able to build ingestion to ADLS and enable BI layer for Analytics               Experience in Machine Learning Studio, Stream Analytics, Event/IoT Hubs, and Cosmos               Strong understanding of Data Modeling and defining conceptual logical and physical data models.               Proficient level experience with architecture design, build and optimization of big data collection, ingestion, storage, processing, and visualization               Working knowledge of RESTful APIs, OAuth2 authorization framework and security best practices for API Gateways               Familiarity of working with unstructured data sets (i.e. voice, image, log files, social media posts, email)                Experience in handling escalations from customer??s operational issues.               Responsibilities     :               Work closely with team members to lead and drive enterprise solutions, advising on key decision points on trade-offs, best practices, and risk mitigation               Guide customers in transforming big data projects,including development and deployment of big data and AI applications               Educate clients on Cloud technologies and influence direction of the solution.               Promote, emphasize, and leverage big data solutions to deploy performant systems that appropriately auto-scale, are highly available, fault-tolerant, self-monitoring, and serviceable               Use a defense-in-depth approach in designing data solutions and AWS/Azure/GCP infrastructure               Assist and advise data engineers in the preparation and delivery of raw data for prescriptive and predictive modeling               Aid developers to identify, design, and implement process improvements with automation tools to optimizing data delivery               Build infrastructure required for optimal extraction, loading and transformation of data from a wide variety of data sources               Work with the developers to maintain and monitor scalable data pipelines               Perform root cause analysis to answer specific business questions and identify opportunities for process improvement               Build out new API integrations to support continuing increases in data volume and complexity               Implement processes and systems to monitor data quality and security, ensuring production data is accurate and available for key stakeholders and the business processes that depend on it               Employ change management best practices to ensure that data remains readily accessible to the business               Maintain tools, processes and associated documentation to manage API gateways and underlying infrastructure               Implement reusable design templates and solutions to integrate, automate, and orchestrate cloud operational needs               Experience with MDM using data governance solutions                     Qualifications:               Overall experience of 12+ years in the IT field.               2+ years of hands-on experience designing and implementing multi-tenant solutions using Azure Databricks for data governance, data pipelines for near real-time data warehouse, and machine learning solutions.               3+ years of design and development experience with scalable and cost-effective      Microsoft Azure/AWS/GCP     data architecture and related solutions                5+ years?? experience in a software development, data engineering, or data analytics field using Python, Scala, Spark, Java, or equivalent technologies                Bachelor??s or Master??s degree in Big Data, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or similar area of study or equivalent work experience               Nice to have-                   Advanced technical certifications: Azure Solutions Architect Professional Google Cloud Certified

column2: Responsibilities A day in the life of an Infoscion As part of the Infosys delivery team, your primary role would be to provide best fit architectural solutions for one or more projects. You would also provide technology consultation and assist in defining scope and sizing of work You would implement solutions, create technology differentiation and leverage partner technologies. Additionally, you would participate in competency development with the objective of ensuring the best-fit and high quality technical solutions. You would be a key contributor in creating thought leadership within the area of technology specialization and in compliance with guidelines, policies and norms of Infosys.If you think you fit right in to help our clients navigate their next in their digital transformation journey, this is the place for you! Technical and Professional Requirements: Strong knowledge of installation, upgrade, patching and cloning of EBS R12.1 and R12.2.x application from single node to multinode architecture. Should have 5 years of strong experience in EBS Implementation, Maintenance Support Projects. Hands-on experience in Oracle WebLogic Server Administration for EBS Suite application. Experience in complex Oracle E-biz upgrades and Cross platform migrations (on-premise as well as Cloud) - from 11i, 12.1.3 to 12.2.x and related database upgrade from 11g to 12c or 19c. Installing, configuring latest version of Oracle Internet Directory, Oracle Access Manager, Oracle Web Center Portal, Oracle Web Center Imaging and Integrate with Oracle E-Biz Suite 12.2.x. Upgrading oracle database to latest version with experience in handling multitenant databases and Disaster Recovery setup for single node as well as Oracle RAC. DMZ setup and configuration with shared appl_top architecture for multinode implementation for EBS Suite application.  Preferred Skills: Technology->Oracle eBS Technical->Oracle Apps DBA  Additional Responsibilities: Knowledge of architectural design patterns, performance tuning, database and functional designs Hands-on experience in Service Oriented Architecture Ability to lead solution development and delivery for the design solutions Experience in designing high level and low level documents is a plus Good understanding of SDLC is a pre-requisite Awareness of latest technologies and trends Logical thinking and problem solving skills along with an ability to collaborate  Educational Requirements Master Of Business Adm.,Master Of Science,Master Of Technology,Master Of Commerce,Master Of Engineering,Bachelor Of Technology,Bachelor Of Science,Bachelor Of Commerce,Bachelor of Engineering  Service Line Enterprise Package Application Services *  Location of posting is subject to business requirements

column2: As an IBM Cloud Architect in the Technology Expert Labs team you will provide architectural advice and solution strategies in the use of IBM Cloud to address our clients' strategic business and technical goals. You will primarily collaborate with our clients to lead and develop the target to-be solution architecture that uses IBM Cloud. These projects may include multiple phases from inception, discovery, design, planning, implementation, workload migration, and hand over of the solution to the designated "day 2" operations team. You will provide solution architecture and technical leadership throughout these phases. Solutions are documented as architectures and can include systems, applications, processes and service components all hosted in IBM Cloud and integrated with client on premise systems in accordance with their hybrid cloud journey. Your Role and Responsibilities IBM Technology Expert Labs Security (IBM Security Professional Services) is looking for Consultant with experience on IBM Security Verify products having developer skills. The candidate will have the ultimate responsibility of delivering the Deployment, configuration and custom development on IBM Security Verify products (ISVA, ISVG, ISAM,ISIM) for Expert Labs customers. This is a customer facing role. This is an opportunity to work with the delivery of professional services for world leading security platform of IBM Security Verify. Be part of a dynamic team delivering professional services to IBM customers. Great opportunity for growth and constantly interesting sets of challenges to solve. IBM Technology Expert Labs Security team thrives on working in dynamic customer facing environments, each offering compelling challenges and exciting opportunities to make a difference. Scoping, Design, Custom development and Implementation of IBM Identity and Access Management and Governance solutions Provide technical expertise to ensure IBM Identity and Access Management solutions are deployed and operating to deliver the technical and business results required by the customer To act as a trusted client advisor to customers Integrating IBM IAM solution with applications Security Practice and Delivery: Participate in client meetings to gather and validate market requirements Lead clients in requirements gathering, system definition and documentation. Participate in project delivery to varying degrees depending on project complexity and geography needs Individual must have a strong interest and expertise in Security in general with preference for Identity and Access Management. A qualified individual would be familiar with industry blogs, key publications in the field of security and would have full awareness of any recent significant security events. Required Technical and Professional Expertise At Least 3 years of experience is required on IBM Identity and Access Management Solutions Sound Knowledge of IBM Security Verify (ISV) IBM Security Access Manager (ISAM) IBM Security Identity Manager (ISIM) Installation and Configuration of ISV ISAM ISIM and its dependent components/products in on-premises as well as on containerized platforms Strong coding experience in Infomap, Java Script (Server-side), Python (Ansible) & Ability to understand and update existing source code. Detailed understanding of Container deployment and orchestration. Detailed understanding of ISVA API flow and end-to-end request response channel. Detailed understanding with DevOps methodologies and container technologies such as OpenShift. Detailed understanding of API platforms and exposure to cross platform API interaction code development. Strong experience in the overall security of Web Infrastructure and best practices.  Understanding of ISVA Representational State Transfer (REST) interfaces. Understanding of configuration, integration and troubleshooting of IBM Security Verify Access Understanding of LDAP Concepts and deep knowledge of IBM Security Directory Server Understanding of creating WebSEAL reverse proxy instances, configurations and SSO integrations with different applications. Knowledge of extension points of IBM Access Management solution. Installation, Configuration and administration of middleware of IBM DB2, IBM WebSphere Application Server Understanding of different MFA features of ISVA Functional knowledge of Authorization delegation and Federation protocols (SAML, OAuth, FIDO, OpenID-Connect) Exxperience on IBM Security Directory Integrator Linux/Unix administration skills Experience in Java, Java Script, Python Excellent Communication and leadership skills Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Relevant Product and Industry certifications (eg. ISV Certification) Working knowledge of Containers Knowledge of virtualization technologies

The team provides high-quality, consistent, and seamless support of Accenture's Voice Services and responsibilities include configuration, implementation, and troubleshooting of Accenture's Global Voice infrastructure as well as its endpoints.Job  Summary :The ISA Global Voice Operations Engineer is responsible for the deployment and operational support of Accenture's Global Voice infrastructure. As part of Accenture's Global Voice team, you will be asked to report and/or escalate issues to management, manage complex projects with minimal supervision or guidance, maintain and update voice system and voice-routing documentation. You will also be working in alignment to processes such as problem management; diagnosis, escalation, tracking and resolution. Perform traffic engineering analysis on network facilities and so on. This role is best filled with someone that has strong voice and network background with mostly voice experience. Also, we are looking for someone that enjoys solving difficult problems with a creative and innovative mindset and working in a collaborative environment. This will be a global role, where the team will be in multiple locations. On-Call responsibilities require after hours and occasional weekend work. Due to the global nature of the infrastructure and the distributed nature of the administration teamwork, hours may vary depending on the incidents in progress, system changes planned, and meetings being held. Technical Responsibilities:Engineer, Deploy and provide Operational support to Accenture's Voice technologies to support business connectivity for both internal and external clients.Provide Tier 3 operational voice support for deployed technologies:Microsoft Teams Ribbon Voice Gateways (1K/2K/5K)Cisco Call Managers, Cisco Cube and other Cisco IPT Voice devicesCisco Webex control HubCall Center APPs (Cisco UCCX/CUAC/Microsoft Call Queues) Voicemail Systems (Cisco Unity)T1/E1/SIP circuits for call routingToll Bypass Voice infrastructurePolycom TelephonyManage vendor and/or product provisioning, procurement, and delivery of voice services hardware and software.Work with multiple teams to ensure that shared infrastructure is meeting functional, service level and budgetary requirements.Maintain a high level of knowledge on the deployment of voice technologies.  Qualifications:EducationDegree/Diploma in an Information Technology discipline or equivalent experience - Diploma in Computer Science/B.Sc./BE/B-Tech. Work Experience 1-3 years of experience with voice and/or network infrastructure management responsibilitiesNetwork & Telephony certification Knowledge and Skill Requirements:Essential Knowledge and Technical SkillsGood analytical, troubleshooting, and problem-solving skillsSolid verbal and written English communication skills.Ability to understand and work with a culturally diverse team across various geographies.Detailed-oriented, enthusiastic, self-starter with ability to work both independently and in a team environment.Ability to handle multiple tasks simultaneously and interact with key executives and customers.Experience developing technical telephony and network documentation.Ability to closely adhere to operational processes and technical standards defined by engineering team or delivery leadership.Ability to complete assigned, recurring tasks with limited supervision. column2: Architecture Planning: You will be involved in planning the overall architecture of the ServiceNow implementation. This includes designing the system architecture, defining data models, and establishing integration patterns with other systems and platforms.     Solution Design: You are responsible for designing the technical solutions using the ServiceNow platform based on the business requirements. This involves analyzing requirements, understanding the existing systems and processes, and designing solutions that leverage ServiceNows capabilities effectively.     System Configuration: You will configure and customize the ServiceNow platform to meet the specific needs of the organization. This includes configuring various modules, defining workflows, creating business rules, and configuring integrations with other systems.     Technical Leadership: You will provide technical guidance and leadership to the development team. You will assist in the resolution of technical challenges, review code and configurations, and ensure adherence to best practices, standards and KPI s.     System Integration: ServiceNow often needs to integrate with other systems and platforms in an organization. As a Technical Architect / Lead, you will design and oversee the implementation of these integrations, ensuring data flows seamlessly between different systems.     Performance Optimization: You will be responsible for monitoring and optimizing the performance of the ServiceNow platform. This involves identifying and resolving performance bottlenecks, conducting performance testing, and implementing best practices to ensure optimal system performance.     Platform Upgrades and Maintenance: You will oversee the upgrade process of the ServiceNow platform to newer versions. This includes planning and coordinating upgrade activities, testing the compatibility of customizations, and ensuring a smooth transition to the upgraded version.     Governance and Compliance: ServiceNow implementations often need to adhere to certain governance and compliance requirements. You will ensure that the system design and configurations meet these requirements, such as data security, access controls, and regulatory compliance.     Stakeholder Management: You will interact with various stakeholders, including business users, project managers, and technical teams, to understand requirements, provide updates, and ensure alignment between business objectives and technical solutions.     Documentation and Training: It is important to maintain comprehensive documentation of the ServiceNow implementation, including system designs, configurations, and integration details. Additionally, you may be responsible for creating training materials and conducting training sessions for end-users and administrators.         about you              Experience in migration of customers from other tools to ServiceNow (CSM module) will be required.     Development experience in areas: Flow Designer, Business Rules, Access Control Rules, Script Includes, Script Action, UI Actions, UI Scripts, UI Policy, Data Policy, Client Scripts, UI Macros, Jelly, Web Services, Glide Record, Glide AJAX, Workflows, JSON, Encryptions Plugin, Notification, Reporting, Discovery (a plus), Integration, SSO, MID Server, LDAP     Migration experience of ServiceNow instances from non-cloud to cloud or cloud to another cloud.     Knowledge on security aspects within SN or during communications between other tools and applications.     Well-versed with the cloud native concepts and methodologies.     Knowledge about process driven application is an added advantage.     Exposure to all stages of Software Development Life Cycle (Agile methodology: Scrum)     Good interpersonal skills, commitment, result-oriented, hard working with a quest and zeal to learn new technologies (micro-services, cloud native, data analysis) and undertake challenging tasks.     Ability to understand Functional Requirements and creation of Design Documents (Techincal Architecture Document).     Configuration experience in following modules on dedicated as well as shared instances (IM, CM, PM, SRM, KM, Release Management, ITOM, Event Management, Configuration Management and Asset Management)     Development experience in areas: Business Rules, Access Control Rules, Script Includes, Script Action, UI Actions, UI Scripts, UI Policy, Data Policy, Client Scripts, UI Macros, Jelly, Web Services, Glide Record, Glide AJAX, Workflows, JSON, Encryptions Plugin, Notification, Reporting, Discovery (a plus), Integration, SSO, MID Server, LDAP     Good written and verbal communication skills, fluent English     Customer centric approach

column2: As a    Senior Presales Solution Architect    at Mendix, you will engage with the largest enterprise customers and prospects across various industry segments. You will be responsible for partnering with our Enterprise Sales Executives to show the value of the Mendix platform to our prospects and customer base. As an out of the box thinker, focus areas will include revealing solutions to Mendix prospects through Solution Architecture workshops, deep dive sessions and Mendix enablement. Building positive relationships across all levels as the technical trusted advisor in these accounts is critical!                     In the role, we drive digital innovation by:             Crafting and delivering individual product presentations and demonstrations (both online and onsite) to our customers     Facilitating workshops with customers to understand their application portfolio and IT landscape     Advising prospects and customers on the use of the Mendix products in their environment     Running technical deep dive and architecture sessions     Executing Proof of Concepts with customers     Supporting Global Marketing team in analyst briefings (Forrester, Gartner, IDC, etc)                       You re the innovator we need if you have:             Minimum five year of relevant Presales Solution Architecture experience with a good understanding of the aPaaS/PaaS and cloud market space     Well versed in complex application architecture, comparing and contrasting technologies against IoT, Middleware, BPM, SOA, 4GL, etc     Experience with Agile methodologies, specifically Scrum     Able to function independently in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment     Experience in conducting workshops, training and consulting engagements     Outstanding communication and relationship management skills - the ability to present and communicate to senior, high profile leaders in English, other languages are a plus     Ability to travel as needed, throughout Asia

column2: A career in our Advisory Acceleration Centre is the natural extension of PwC s leading class global delivery capabilities     We provide premium, cost effective, high quality services that support process quality and delivery capability in support for client engagements     As a Senior Manager, you'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution         PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this management level include but are not limited to:         Encourage everyone to have a voice and invite opinion from all, including quieter members of the team.     Deal effectively with ambiguous and unstructured problems and situations.     Initiate open and candid coaching conversations at all levels.     Move easily between big picture thinking and managing relevant detail.     Anticipate stakeholder needs, and develop and discuss potential solutions, even before the stakeholder realises they are required.     Contribute technical knowledge in area of specialism.     Contribute to an environment where people and technology thrive together to accomplish more than they could apart.     Navigate the complexities of cross-border and/or diverse teams and engagements.     Initiate and lead open conversations with teams, clients and stakeholders to build trust.     Uphold the firms code of ethics and business conduct.                 About the Role   :             You'll work as part of a team of problem solvers, helping to solve complex business issues from strategy to execution.              PwC Professional skills and responsibilities for this level include but are not limited to:                   Primary point of Technical contact for AWS Modernization programs             Lead Architectural discussions for AWS Cloud engagements across multiple industry sectors             Understand, influence, and promote the PwC s Cloud strategy             Lead the creation of technical content, architecture patterns/models; create proofs of concepts             Perform full integration of DevOps tools that support continuous integration and continuous delivery             Make informed decisions about customers Cloud Infrastructure/Architecture understanding the impact of design decisions             Plan and prioritize your own and project team s work. Follow tasks to their logical conclusion and make sure that everything has been done to the right standard             Provide inputs on the development of design, implementation, operations, user guides, and training materials             Provide responsive advice, counsel, education and service concerning IT issues and trends in the IT industry. Mentor team members in technical topics             Maintain knowledge and understanding of current and emerging technologies, equipment and systems. Review and provide input standard operating procedures             Collaborate with other technical and non-technical team members, clients, and vendors to define, build, and deliver solutions             Required Qualifications:             12+ years of full-time years of IT experience; Prior consulting, Professional Services and/or Enterprise Experience preferred. 6+ years of experience in cloud implementation and architecture             Experience in major cloud technologies including virtualization, containers, networking, etc on AWS             Experience with fundamental storage concepts: filesystems, backup, cloning, snapshotting, logical volume management, disk encryption             A proven record of success in implementing and leading large scale cloud platform development or enterprise-wide scalable and high-availability operations in a cloud environment             Expertise across cloud computing, infrastructure, IT operations, applications, data management, and cloud governance models with ability to advise on industry-leading approaches             Knowledge in hardware virtualization (servers, storage, and networks), grid computing, internet security protocols and standards, application, integration, and data architecture             Experience in DevOps, Agile, and Scrum constructs - Developing strategies and approaches to optimize the implementation of cloud resources and capabilities             Experience in designing and developing microservices architecture             Hands on experience with AWS Services like VPC, EC2, S3, ELB, RDS, ECS/EKS, IAM, CloudFront, CloudWatch, SQS/SNS, Lambda             Knowledge of appropriate cloud services to design and deploy architecture and applications based on given customer and/or Solutions Architect s requirements.             Ability to apply DevOps including IaaC using Terraform / CloudFormation, configuration management using Chef / Ansible, CI/CD using Jenkins / CodeDeploy, etc to incrementally automate, modernize, and improve customers environments             Understand cloud security controls, auditing capabilities network boundary controls, and related toolsets; and compliant environments including PCI, HIPAA, etc                 Experience in performing migrations to a cloud environment leveraging tools similar to CloudEndure, AWS Database Migration Service, etc                 Experience in various database engines like MySQL, PostgreSQL, MSSQL, MongoDB             Experience in developing software in two or more of the following languages: Java, Python, Ruby, C#, Node.js, Typescript, etc             Experience in containerization using Docker or Kubernetes, preferably in a cloud environment and leveraging Git or other source control methodology                         Minimum Education Required:     Bachelor s degree (BE, B Tech, MCA, M Tech or equivalent)             Certification(s) Preferred   :    One or more Architect certifications from AWS

column2: We are seeking an experienced Data Architect to lead the design and implementation of our data architecture and management strategies.  The Data Architect will be responsible for defining how the data will be stored, consumed, integrated, and managed by different data entities and IT systems, as well as any applications using or processing that data in some way.  Collaboration with IT teams, management, and data scientists to determine the needs of the organization and how to fulfill them with a robust and scalable data architecture is key to this role. Skills Required:  Extensive experience in data architecture, modeling, and design. In-depth understanding of database structure principles. Experience with data warehouse design (e.g., dimensional modeling) and data mining. Knowledge of various database management systems (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL, MongoDB). Proficiency with data modeling tools (e.g., ERWin, Enterprise Architect, Visio). Familiarity with data visualization tools and reporting software. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent understanding of data administration and management functions (collection, analysis, distribution, etc.). Familiarity with data privacy and protection guidelines and laws. Location - Hyderabad,ahmedabad,pune,chennai,kolkata.

column2: Requirements Analysis:    Conduct thorough analysis of business requirements, collaborating with stakeholders to understand their needs, processes, and objectives for the ERP system.           Solution Design:    Develop comprehensive ERP system architectures and designs, considering scalability, performance, security, and integration requirements.           Implementation:    Lead the implementation of the ERP system, overseeing the execution of design plans, customization, configuration, and integration efforts to ensure successful deployment within the organization.           System Integration:    Design and implement seamless integration between ERP system and other enterprise applications, databases, and third-party solutions.           Customization and Configuration:    Lead the customization and configuration of ERP software to align with specific business processes and requirements, ensuring optimal functionality and user experience.            Stakeholder Management:    Collaborate with stakeholders across departments, including business leaders, IT professionals, and end-users, to gather feedback, address concerns, and ensure alignment with organizational goals.           Team Leadership:    Provide leadership and guidance to a team of developers and consultants involved in the ERP implementation, ensuring adherence to project timelines, quality standards, and best practices.           System Integrator Management:    Oversee external system integrators or consulting companies involved in the ERP implementation, ensuring alignment with project goals, timelines, and quality standards.           Risk Management:    Identify and mitigate potential risks and issues associated with ERP implementation projects, proactively addressing challenges to ensure successful delivery and user adoption.           Documentation and Training:    Develop comprehensive technical documentation, training materials, and support resources to facilitate smooth ERP system deployment, user training, and ongoing maintenance.           Problem Solving   : Identify and address complex technical challenges that may arise during the implementation of the solution. Troubleshoot issues and provide timely resolutions to keep the project on track.           Communication   : Effectively communicate technical concepts and design decisions to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Ensure that everyone involved in the project understands the architecture and its benefits.           Quality Assurance   : Ensure that the final solution meets quality and performance standards by conducting reviews, tests, and assessments throughout the development and implementation phases.           Continuous Improvement:    Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance the functionality, efficiency, and effectiveness of the ERP system, collaborating with stakeholders to prioritize and implement enhancements based on evolving business needs.             School Background / Working Seniority         7+ years of experience in relevant roles, including significant experience in solution design and architecture.          5+ Oracle EBS or Oracle ERP Cloud experience          Proven track record of successfully delivering complex solutions and may have experience leading architecture teams.          Bachelors degree in a relevant field such as Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration, or a related discipline.          International experience is mandatory.                         Technical / Functional skills         Oracle EBS Expertise: In-depth knowledge and hands-on experience with Oracle E-Business Suite (EBS) modules, including but not limited to Financials, Supply Chain Management, Human Capital Management, Procurement, Manufacturing, and Customer Relationship Manage         Solution Architecture: Proficiency in designing end-to-end solutions using Oracle EBS, including system architecture, integration strategies, data migration approaches, and customization/configuration techniques.         Oracle EBS Implementation: Extensive experience leading Oracle EBS implementation projects from initiation to post-implementation support, encompassing requirements gathering, solution design, development, testing, deployment, and user training.         Integration Technologies: Strong understanding of integration technologies and tools for Oracle EBS, such as Oracle Integration Cloud, Oracle SOA Suite or similar provided by other vendors.         Customization and Extension: Ability to customize and extend Oracle EBS functionality using tools like Oracle APEX, Oracle Workflow, Oracle BI Publisher, Oracle VBCS.         Data Management: Proficiency in data modeling, data migration, and data conversion techniques for Oracle EBS, including data cleansing, transformation, and loading.         Performance Optimization: Expertise in performance tuning and optimization of Oracle EBS applications and databases, including SQL tuning, index optimization, cache management, and system configuration optimization.         Security and Compliance: Knowledge of Oracle EBS security features, role-based access controls (RBAC), and compliance requirements, including Sarbanes-Oxley (SOX) and General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), to ensure data privacy and regulatory compliance. Technical Certification in Cloud (eg, Azure)                 Customer Centricity             Identifies and evaluates industry trends (customer industry verticals, information technology [IT] industry), gathers customer/partner insights (eg, feedback around technical preferences, environments, business needs, competitive landscape), and maps architecture and digital transformation solutions to customer/partner business outcomes.          Acts as the voice of the customer (VOC)/partner by driving new feedback, insights, and resources across territories to add and prioritize. Represents the customer/partner to internal teams (eg, Engineering) to shape products and services by providing insights across the territory.          Leverages feedback to develop strategic and actionable insights and presents business cases to program managers to influence product roadmaps and decision making. Shares customer/partner success stories with the wider internal team.         Develops and expands existing impactful relationships with customer and partner architects, C-level technical decision makers (TDMs), and business stakeholders (to the extent that the customer/partner will call for consultation without being prompted). Provides direction to TDMs and builds the bridge between TDMs and business decision makers (BDMs).          Uncovers, aggregates, and synthesizes data about customer/partner business, complex technical requirements and issues (eg, involving great length or tenacity to resolve), and various technical strategies being proposed. Addresses requirements/issues/strategies with win-win technical architecture(s) and demonstrates and proves the capability and value of those solutions through design collaboration sessions with the customer/partner.          Contributes to and understands how works aligns with customer success plan and delivers customer outcomes by driving partnerships with the appropriate internal teams/resources. Supports customer skilling by leading discussions on technical delivery with other internal and external stakeholders as a technical thought leader to influence customer readiness.         Guides other team members to focus on customer/partner experience through efficient delivery and ensuring a seamless and connected customer experience.          Drives definition of customer/partner conditions of success. Anticipates customer/partner dissatisfaction and unmet needs and helps create strategies to improve experience, value realization, and acceleration of customer transformation.         Actively listens, creates, and sustains constructive tension and trust with customers/partners by respectfully challenging their decisions and/or areas where they might do more and encouraging them to consider alternative architectures/solutions and approaches.                     Business Impact             Drives their team in operating and optimizing complex and high-impact situations for strategic customers/partners in collaboration with internal stakeholders (eg, Customer Services and Support, Customer Success Account Management, other Account Team members, Product Groups). Anticipates and manages business and technical risks, and adapts methodology and applies governance to identify, communicate, and minimize business and technical risks. Adheres to quality assurance standards and calculates risks while ensuring excellence in the design and/or delivery of solutions. Leverages standard tools to ensure accurate opportunity and milestone execution and pipeline hygiene.         Owns complex customers/partner relationships to anticipate, identify, propose resolution, and lead removal of technical blockers through regular technical reviews and check-ins to accelerate consumption and solution implementations. Anticipates and routes non-technical issues for removal by the appropriate party. Applies broad business, technical, industry, and/or enterprise knowledge to architecture or support projects to meet business and information technology (IT) requirements and resolve identified constraints. Shapes and enhances customers requirements.         Proactively uses deep knowledge of the products, services, and value propositions of Microsoft and its competitors in customer/partner conversations and to propose and coach others to develop new solutions to scale across multiple customers/partners while demonstrating the business case and presenting alternative scenarios. Optimizes to drive customer consumption and aligns with Customer Success Account Management or other Account Team members on customer/partner priorities to drive growth in consumption via cost optimization, operational excellence performance efficiency, and security.          Creates opportunities to expand or accelerate cloud consumption (including through cloud related managed intellectual property [MIP]) and leads these customer/partner conversations.          Leads architecture design, resiliency reviews, and technical optimization across multiple applications for the customer/partner, resulting in production deployment application and increased customer/partner usage and consumption. Ensures that the customer/partners applications have as few points of failure as possible.          Provides thought leadership to help drive technical solution design, development, and deployment and supports the customer/partner throughout implementation to achieve value outcomes and Microsofts Customer Promise.         Leads the adoption of Microsoft offerings based on analysis/differentiation of Microsoft and competitor products to influence the industry-wide direction for specific architecture(s).                     Technical Leadership             Leverages market insights to assist leadership in defining global vision by identifying relevant areas in which to drive up-skilling. Role models effective technical readiness and influences team to drive their own technical readiness.          Drives and engages others to adapt to changes aligned with solution areas/services priorities. Organizes or presents at internal events (eg, Ready, Build, Ignite). column2: This is a permanent work from home position from anywhere in India Notice period - less than 30 Days (Immediate joiners preferred)  Job Summary:  We are seeking an experienced Teamcenter PLM Architect to join our team. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing and defining Teamcenter architecture, data models for CAD, Document, and Requirement Management, and integrating CAD and ALM. This role involves Teamcenter customization, configuration, development, and solution mapping. The candidate will work on solution definition and development for Teamcenter, including integration with third-party applications and other PLM-related tasks. Key Responsibilities: Teamcenter Architecture and Design: Define and design Teamcenter architecture, including data models for CAD, Document, and Requirement Management. Integrate CAD and ALM within the Teamcenter environment. Teamcenter Customization and Development: Customize, configure, and develop Teamcenter solutions according to business requirements. Map raw requirements to PLM/Teamcenter framework and design PLM application landscapes. Solution Definition and Development: Design solutions for Teamcenter Client and Server applications and integrate with third-party applications. Manage multi-site data transfer and administration. Work with BMIDE Naming/Revision rules, deep copy rules, action rules, and BMIDE packaging (hot and cold deployment). Integration and Migration: Integrate Teamcenter with ECAD (e.g., Altium), CAD (UGNX), SolidWorks, AutoCAD, and other applications. Work with CAD UGNX, Part, Assembly, Drafting, Part Families, Reuse Library, UDF Library, and Import-Export functions. Perform D2 Documentum to Teamcenter migration (e.g., Docs, DHF, DMR). Manage Teamcenter Polarion Integration, T4S Configuration, and Customization. Teamcenter Configuration and Management: Utilize Teamcenter UA (Workflow, Structure Manager, Access Manager, Preference Manager, MPP, BOM Management, Query, PLM XML). Work with BOM Management and other Teamcenter customization tasks. Project Leadership and Support: Lead and direct junior architects and developer resources engaged in understanding business requirements and developing IT system solutions. Collaborate with Teamcenter Enterprise Architect, Teamcenter Developers, and business SMEs to evaluate and improve business processes. Support PLM Project Managers in planning and applying technical elements of change and risk management. Implementation and Best Practices: Drive projects and implementations following ALM/Tollgate and Agile/SCRUM processes as appropriate. Promote conformance to established system and solution architecture standards and best practices. Qualifications and Skills: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field. Proven experience in Teamcenter architecture and PLM solution design. Proficiency in Teamcenter customization, configuration, development, and solution mapping. Experience with integration tools and third-party applications, including ECAD, CAD, and others. Strong understanding of BMIDE, multi-site data transfer, and deployment. Familiarity with PLM-related tools, BOM management, and other Teamcenter functions. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Strong project management and risk management capabilities. Knowledge of Agile/SCRUM methodologies and ALM/Tollgate processes.

The Solution Architect is accountable to the Project Manager for the architecture of a solution being developed and implemented until the successful deployment of the solution. This includes:a. Being the point of call for all architecture aspects of an IT Project.b. Being able to address and integrate the: Business Process, Data, Application, Technical and Information Security aspects of an IT Solution.c. Ensure projects solution architecture is documented using the relevant templates, tooling and conforms to standards.d. Coach detailed designers and business analysts in projects during their design work.e. Reviewing and accepting the detailed design of an IT solution.f. Support Segment Architects and reviews through the Architecture Review Board as required.     Take an active role in documenting, improving & maintaining the Reference Models in Systems Architect. Lifting project deliverables to the Conceptual and Logical levels.     Follow IT Technology developments in the market and leverage this knowledge in architecting solutions in Shell. Ensure solutions are 'future-proof'     Stay in touch with development of standards and standard services in IT at Shell. To ensure the latest service developments are taken into account.     Pro-actively contribute to the development of the Architecture community and be an ambassador for Architecture. Interact with stakeholders on architecture issues and strategic improvements where such expertise is required.     Maintain knowledge of compliance and regulatory requirements, including data privacy regulations (e.g. GDPR), and ensure that those are included in architecture design decisions.     Responsible for championing and embedding Security by Design and Privacy by Design in projects, and to ensure that the appropriate design decisions are made, documented and implemented. column2: As Solution Architect working in the Application Management Delivery role, you are responsible for designing and implementing technology solutions that meet the business requirements and objectives of an organization     Your primary focus is on managing and delivering application-related projects and initiatives     Here are some key responsibilities as Solution Architect in an Application Management Delivery role at NCC delivery:     ?     1. Solution Design: Collaborating with stakeholders including business analysts, project managers, and development teams to understand the business needs and translate them into technical solutions. This involves creating comprehensive solution design documents that outline the architecture, components, data flow, integration points, security measures, and performance considerations.       2. System Integration: Identifying opportunities for system integration to ensure seamless communication and data exchange between applications. This includes evaluating existing systems and technologies within the organizations IT landscape to determine compatibility and feasibility.       3. Technology Evaluation: Conducting research on emerging technologies, frameworks, platforms, and tools to assess their suitability for meeting the organizations application management objectives. This involves analyzing costs, benefits, risks, scalability factors, vendor support options, and alignment with industry best practices.       4. Technical Leadership: Providing technical guidance throughout the project lifecycle by collaborating with cross-functional teams such as developers, testers, infrastructure specialists to ensure adherence to architectural standards. You will also provide mentorship or training sessions for development teams on new technologies or architectural principles.       5. Performance Optimization: Analyzing application performance metrics during different stages of development or post-production phases to identify bottlenecks or areas for optimization. This includes recommending improvements or changes related to infrastructure setup (servers/networks), code optimization techniques (caching mechanisms), database queries optimization (indexing strategies), or other relevant optimizations.       6. Risk Mitigation: Identifying potential risks related to security vulnerabilities, compliance issues or technology limitations in proposed solutions and providing recommendations for mitigating those risks effectively.       7.Technical Documentation: Creating detailed technical documentation including architecture diagrams/specifications/user guides that are understandable by both technical team members as well as non-technical stakeholders like project managers or business users.     8. Ensure technical guidelines are followed and practiced and shared between the different development teams and members in the AM team delivery.     9. As solution architect within the AM delivery you will also be asked to do development in few applications currently maintained within the AM delivery.       Overall, a Solution Architect in an Application Management Delivery role plays a crucial part in ensuring that applications are designed efficiently while meeting business goals while considering factors such as scalability , reliability , maintainability , and security throughout their lifecycle       Skills:        Analytical Thinking     Solutions Architecture     Delivery Management
column11: Post production, Delivery management, Business consulting, CGI, Architecture, Analytical, System integration, Manager Technology, Solution Architect, Technical documentation

column2: As a member of the Professional Services team, the Solution Architect is responsible for the integrity of the architecture, functional solution design, and technical development and is ultimately responsible for the delivery of high-quality solutions to our customers.      The Solution Architect is also responsible for mentoring consultants and as a resource for other Solution Architects coming up-to-speed on the Tungsten Automation Corporation suite of products and the implementation process.     As a member of the Solution Architecture group, the Solution Architect needs to be able to notice trends across customer implementations to then help improve the implementation process by creating re-usable assets and refining the implementation processes.     Solution Architects are also responsible for working across the global Tungsten Automation Professional Services & Technical Support organizations.                     Key Responsibilities                     Responsible for the integrity of the solution design, development and quality of assigned projects meeting the business needs of the client and Tungsten Automation Corporation implementation standards                 Own resolution of technical and product issues on assigned projects from initial point of engagement through go-live of the solution                 Ensure best practices and consistent delivery approaches are utilized on assigned projects                 Provide input to Project Managers on project planning and estimating efforts for each assigned project                 Drive to structure work and produce deliverables that align with the scope and budget of projects                 Structuring and driving design reviews                 Ensure all projects utilize development standards                 Participate in the development of solutions conceived, driven and owned by Professional Services                 Create high quality solution design and design documentation                 Present, articulate and defend the design orally, visually and in writing to clients                 Translate client requirements (sometimes creatively) into the current available product and determine where gaps may exist                 Manage client expectations related to the design to reach successful client sign-off                 Conduct code reviews where appropriate                 Provide oversight to Consultants to ensure all project work is consistent with the solution design and Tungsten Automation Corporation implementation standards                 Provide guidance and mentorship to all levels of Consultants and Solution Architects in technical and product knowledge                 Effectively manage time across multiple concurrent projects                 Participate in identifying and creating re-usable assets to improve efficiency and consistency of delivery across projects.                 Provide input to Project Managers for project planning and estimating efforts on project based on varying project resource skills                 Communicate the risks and benefits of design/architectural options to an audience with diverse technical backgrounds                 Assist in business development efforts in terms of solution definition scope and estimation efforts, where appropriate             Required Skills                             10+ years of solution development experience           Strong written communication, clear verbal communication and presentation skills to enable interactions with a global employee and customer base            Multiple language skills are a plus (eg, French, German, Dutch, etc)                    Able to effectively communicate and guide clients to desired outcomes                 Ability to lead senior Consultants and junior Consultants                             Ability to work in a communication-rich team environment                 Understanding of the overall project plan and specific scope of projects                 Ability to see the big picture when making decisions and able to estimate effort for implementation tasks                             Strong technical implementation skills                 Able to assist in business development activities including supporting definition of scope and estimation                       Solid documentation skills                             Proven track record of delivering projects on time and within budget                               Ability to travel to customer project locations as needed                       Required Experience                 bachelors Degree or equivalent in Computer Science, Information Systems or related specialization. column2: The job opening is for an individual contributor in the Solution Engineering team.            The candidate should be an Electrical Engineering graduate with approximately 12-15 years of experience in the field of project electrical engineering.            In project electrical engineering, the scope is engineering of Outdoor Switchyard, Indoor Substation and E-House projects in bid and execution phase.            The engineering deliverables are Single Line Diagram, Layout (Equipment, Cable Route, Earthing, Illumination, EKD, Lightning protection, etc.), Cable Schedule, Relay Setting, Bill of Material and Electrical Calculations (Earthing, Cable Sizing, Battery and Charger Sizing, Illumination, Lightning Protection, BPI cantilever, Short Circuit Force, Sag tension, etc.). The candidate should have the experience of preparing these documents. The candidate should have knowledge of relay selection, relay protection functions and SCADA. Working knowledge of ACAD is required.            The candidate should be able to review the product and system documents such as EHV, MV and LV Switchboard, CRP, SAS, MEP, FDA, etc., used in the project.            The candidate should have good knowledge of electrical standards such as IS, IEC, IEEE, CBIP, CEA, etc.            The candidate should have good communication skill. Communication with internal partners such as factory, execution team, bid team, sales team and external partners such as customer, consultant, vendor, etc., is required for this position.

column2: About the Role In this Role you will be collaborating with other professionals to determine functional and non-functional requirements for new software or applications. Using tools and methodologies to create representations for functions and user interface of desired product, developing high-level product specifications with attention to system integration and feasibility. Your Team The SW Architect will report to the System Engineering Manager/Director and will typically be assigned to multiple projects. This position does not have any direct reports.? What You Will Do Develop and contribute in defining software design strategy for the area of responsibility (e.g. Project, Domain, BU ENG, Application). Identify architectural constraints for the architectural level (project, domain, application) based on technical and organizational requirements and decompose them to architectural levels below. Develop software architecture for the assigned architectural level fulfilling the architectural requirements. Define, develop and verify all interfaces to related SW architectural elements are complete. Describe, evaluate and verify dynamic behavior and interaction between the related SW architectural elements. Analyze customer requirement and map them to existing architecture or extend the architecture starting from RFQ/RFI phase. Analyze and address architectural relevant nonfunctional requirements. Ensure traceability and consistency to system architecture and to software requirements. What You Need Masters or bachelor?? degree in electrical, computer engineering or similar discipline. Knowledge of embedded software, system and understanding of Linux OS kernel and user space. Proven technical leadership and ability to clearly communicate in English, both verbally and in writing. Expert knowledge and experience of Software Architecture. Experience with design methods (e.g. UML or SysML) and modeling tools and languages. Ability to document comprehensively and concisely, decision making and problem-solving ability. Required 12+ Years experience. What is Nice to Have Knowledge of process models (e.g. Automotive SPICE? specially SWE.2). Competent on Automotive Cybersecurity Engineering (ISO 21434). Competent on TARA methodologies. Knowledge of cryptography application in automotive ecosystem. Knowledge of secure coding standards. Knowledge of Automotive Functional Safety (ISO 26262). What Makes You Eligible Be willing to travel up to 30%, domestic only OR domestic and international travel. What We Offer  We offer an authentic diverse, equal, and inclusive work environment that fosters and encourages professional and personal development in a truly global organization. You will work on products and services that touch people?? lives and will change the industrial standards, being a part of the transformations in our industry. Our work environments are fast paced, challenging, empowering, collaborative, flexible and exciting. We offer our own HARMAN University with regular updates on the new technologies and trends by utilizing various sessions organized by Self Learning and Development Trainings to help grow and advance talent. We offer competitive compensation/benefit programs and recognition programs.
